power_control_disabled - the tx power is strictly controlled using HCI_VS_Power_Control_Set_Level

Values.name: Rwin_Override
Values.Value: use the poll override threshold to override rwin

Values.name: HCI_LE_Testmode_Hop_Step
Values.Value: BLE test TX frequency hopping step. When step is 0, there is no hopping; when step is non-zero, TX frequency hops in data channels (only) with the specified step. For example, 0x00 indicates BLE test without hopping, while 0x02 indicates BLE test with TX frequency hopping among data channels using a hopping step of 2 in channel index.

Values.name: HCIPP_Frequency_Mode
Values.Value: Single freq for both BT and BLE

Values.name: Ber_Meter_Packet_Length
Values.Value: Number of bytes per packet payload, according to packet type

Values.name: Ber_Meter_PRBS_Init_Val
Values.Value: The value from which the PRBS pattern generator should start

Values.name: Ber_Meter_Single_Run
Values.Value: Stop ber meter after one test

Values.name: Ber_Meter_Status_Reset_Counters
Values.Value: Reset counters when command is received

Values.name: Ber_Meter_Status_Finished_One_Test
Values.Value: When one test was completed. The Read command resets it back to 0

Param.Name: Content_Format
Param.Desc: voice settings

Param.Name: Retransmission_Effort
Param.Desc: 0x00 - no retr. 0x01 - optimize for power consumption, 0x02 - optimize for link quality, 0xFF - don't care

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Connection Handle to be used to identify a connection. Range: 0x0000 – 0x0EFF (0x0F00 – 0x0FFF Reserved for future use).

Param.Name: Transmit_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: Maximum possible transmit bandwidth in octets per second. 0xFFFFFFFF - Don't care.

Param.Name: Receive_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: Maximum possible receive bandwidth in octets per second. 0xFFFFFFFF - Don't care.

Param.Name: Transmit_Coding_Format
Param.Desc: The transmit air coding format specify coding format used for transmit. Octet 1-2: Company ID. Octet 3-4: Vendor specific codec ID. Shall be ignored if octet 0 of Transmit_Coding_Format is not 0xFF.

Param.Name: Receive_Coding_Format
Param.Desc: The receive air coding format specify coding format used for receive. Octet 1-2: Company ID. Octet 3-4: Vendor specific codec ID. Shall be ignored if octet 0 of Transmit_Coding_Format is not 0xFF.

Param.Name: Transmit_Codec_Frame_Size
Param.Desc: The actual size of the air codec frame in octets. Range: 0x0001-0xFFFF. 0x0000 - Reserved.

Param.Name: Receive_Codec_Frame_Size
Param.Desc: The actual size of the air codec frame in octets. Range: 0x0001-0xFFFF. 0x0000 - Reserved.

Param.Name: Input_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: Host to Controller nominal data rate in octets per second.

Param.Name: Output_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: Controller to Host nominal data rate in octets per second.

Param.Name: Input Coding_Format
Param.Desc: Octet 1-2: Company ID. Octet 3-4: Vendor specific codec ID. Shall be ignored if octet 0 of Input_Coding_Format is not 0xFF.

Param.Name: Output Coding_Format
Param.Desc: Octet 1-2: Company ID. Octet 3-4: Vendor specific codec ID. Shall be ignored if octet 0 of Input_Coding_Format is not 0xFF.

Param.Name: Input_Coded_Data_Size
Param.Desc: Size, in bits, of the sample or framed data

Param.Name: Output_Coded_Data_Size
Param.Desc: Size, in bits, of the sample or framed data

Param.Name: Input_PCM_Sample_Payload_MSB_Position
Param.Desc: The number of bit positions within an audio sample that the MSB of the sample is away from starting at the MSB of the data.

Param.Name: Output_PCM_Sample_Payload_MSB_Position
Param.Desc: The number of bit positions within an audio sample that the MSB of the sample is away from starting at the MSB of the data.

Param.Name: Input Data Path
Param.Desc: 0x00-HCI, 0x01-0xFE - Logical_Channel_Number (vendor specifically defined). 0xFF - Audio test mode (unsupported parameter).

Param.Name: Output Data Path
Param.Desc: 0x00-HCI, 0x01-0xFE - Logical_Channel_Number (vendor specifically defined). 0xFF - Audio test mode (unsupported parameter).

Param.Name: Input_Transport_Unit_Size
Param.Desc: Range: 0x01-0xFF, The number of bits in each unit of data received from the Host over the audio data transport. 0x00 - Not applicable.

Param.Name: Output_Transport_Unit_Size
Param.Desc: Range: 0x01-0xFF, The number of bits in each unit of data sent to the Host over the audio data transport. 0x00 - Not applicable.

Param.Name: Max_Latency
Param.Desc: Range: 0x0000-0x0003: Reserved. 0x0004-0xFFFe:The value in milliseconds representing the upper limit of the sum of the synchronous interval, and the size of the eSCO window, where the eSCO window is the reserved slots plus the retransmission window. 0xFFFF: Don't Care.

Param.Name: Retransmission_Effort
Param.Desc: 0x00 - no retr. 0x01 - optimize for power consumption, 0x02 - optimize for link quality, 0xFF - don't care

Param.Name: Transmit_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: Maximum possible transmit bandwidth in octets per second. 0xFFFFFFFF - Don't care.

Param.Name: Receive_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: Maximum possible receive bandwidth in octets per second. 0xFFFFFFFF - Don't care.

Param.Name: Transmit_Coding_Format
Param.Desc: The transmit air coding format specify coding format used for transmit. Octet 1-2: Company ID. Octet 3-4: Vendor specific codec ID. Shall be ignored if octet 0 of Transmit_Coding_Format is not 0xFF.

Param.Name: Receive_Coding_Format
Param.Desc: The receive air coding format specify coding format used for receive. Octet 1-2: Company ID. Octet 3-4: Vendor specific codec ID. Shall be ignored if octet 0 of Transmit_Coding_Format is not 0xFF.

Param.Name: Transmit_Codec_Frame_Size
Param.Desc: The actual size of the air codec frame in octets. Range: 0x0001-0xFFFF. 0x0000 - Reserved.

Param.Name: Receive_Codec_Frame_Size
Param.Desc: The actual size of the air codec frame in octets. Range: 0x0001-0xFFFF. 0x0000 - Reserved.

Param.Name: Input_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: Host to Controller nominal data rate in octets per second.

Param.Name: Output_Bandwidth

Param.Name: Input Coding_Format

Param.Name: Output Coding_Format

Param.Name: MWS_RX_Center_Frequency
Param.Desc: The MWS_RX_Center_Frequency and MWS_TX_Center_Frequency parameters are used to indicate the center frequency of the MWS device’s uplink (TX) and downlink (RX) channels. Note that the uplink and downlink channel centers may be the same value or different values.

Param.Name: MWS_TX_Center_Frequency
Param.Desc: The MWS_RX_Center_Frequency and MWS_TX_Center_Frequency parameters are used to indicate the center frequency of the MWS device’s uplink (TX) and downlink (RX) channels. Note that the uplink and downlink channel centers may be the same value or different values.

Param.Name: MWS_RX_Channel_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: The MWS_RX_Channel_Bandwidth and MWS_TX_Channel_Bandwidth parameters are used to indicate the bandwidth, in kHz, of the MWS device’s uplink and downlink channels.

Param.Name: MWS_TX_Channel_Bandwidth
Param.Desc: The MWS_RX_Channel_Bandwidth and MWS_TX_Channel_Bandwidth parameters are used to indicate the bandwidth, in kHz, of the MWS device’s uplink and downlink channels.

Command.name: HCI_VS_Snoop_Enable
Command.Desc: The snoop enable command is used by primary host to setup and remove snoop channel, which track the ACL and eSCO (if exists) between the source and the primary.

ExtDesc.p: The snoop enable command is used by primary host to setup and remove snoop channel, which track the ACL and eSCO (if exists) between the source and the primary.
Event(s) generated:

When the Controller receives the snoop enable command, it shall send the Command Status event to the Host.
In addition, when the Link Manager determines the snoop channel is established, the Controller, on both Controllers, shall send VS Snoop Mode event (and VS Snoop eSCO Status event, if voice exists) to each Host.

Param.Name: Snoop enable
Param.Desc: 0: Remove snoop channel, 1: Setup snoop channel

Param.Name: Source Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle for the ACL source device.

Param.Name: Secondary Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle for the ACL secondary device.

Command.name: HCI_VS_ACL_Flow
Command.Desc: The ACL flow command is used by host to block all ACL RX traffic (ACL-U and ACL-C) from remote device.

ExtDesc.p: The ACL flow command is used by host to block all ACL RX traffic (ACL-U and ACL-C) from remote device.
Event(s) generated:

When the Controller receives the ACL flow command, it shall send the Command Status event to the Host.
In addition, when the Link Controller complete the procedure, it shall send a VS ACL Flow Complete event to the Host.

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle for the remote device.

Param.Name: Flow enable
Param.Desc: 0: flow STOP, 1: flow GO

Param.Name: LE disconnection

Param.Name: LE Involuntary disconnections
Param.Desc: Disconnections of LE connections that were dropped explicitly involuntarily.

ExtDesc.p: Clear connection statistics

Command.name: HCI_VS_Snoop_Switch
Command.Desc: The snoop switch command is used by primary host to switch roles (primary/secondary) with secondary earbud.

ExtDesc.p:
The snoop switch command is used by primary host to switch roles (primary/secondary) with secondary earbud.
Usage (must follow exact order of commands):
1) Primary and Secondary perform prioritizing to UTP link via HCI_VS_UTP_Prioritze_for_Bud_Swap command
2) Old primary and secondary perform ACL flow STOP for snoop link via HCI_VS_ACL_Flow command
3) Old primary perform switch snoop link via HCI_VS_Snoop_Switch command
4) New primary and secondary perform ACL flow GO for snoop link via HCI_VS_ACL_Flow command
5) New primary set new local BD_ADDR (to public bd_addr of old primary) via HCI_VS_Write_BD_ADDR command
6) New primary perform role switch on UTP link (in order to become master of the UTP link) via HCI_Switch_Role command
7) New secondary set new local BD_ADDR (to private bd_addr of old secondary) via HCI_VS_Write_BD_ADDR command
8) Primary and Secondary disable prioritizing to UTP link via HCI_VS_UTP_Prioritze_for_Bud_Swap command
Event(s) generated:

When the Controller receives the snoop switch command, it shall send the Command Status event to the Host.
In addition, when the Link Manager determines the snoop switch is completed, the Controller, on both Controllers, shall send a VS Snoop Switch Complete event to each Host.

In addition, when the Prediction Enable sequence is completed, the controller shall send a VS Prediction Enable Complete event to the Host.

Command.name: HCI_VS_Fast_Connect_Enable
Command.Desc: The Fast Connect Enable command is used by host to Enable/Disable Fast connect feature.

ExtDesc.p:
The Fast Connect Enable command is used by host to Enable/Disable Fast connect feature.
This command should run before LE Advertise/scan is enabled, and before any other "Fast connect related VS commands".
The command enable proprietary "LE Scan Req Fast Connect Request Event", that pops during Fast connect process.

Param.Name: Fast Connect enable
Param.Desc: 0: Fast Connect Disable, 1: Fast Connect Enable

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Fast_Connect_Write_Scan_Request_Data
Command.Desc: The command configures scan request data (Fast connect configuration command)

ExtDesc.p:
The command configures scan request data for Fast connect process. This command is dedicated for the LE scanner, for Bud2Bud fast connect.
Scan request data will be added to the scan req packet only when fast connect was enabled by using the fast connect enable command,
and when the received advertiser resolvable private address was resolved and was configured by the following command: HCI_VS_LE_Fast_Connect_Write_Peer_Bud_Irk.
An alternative (Debug) for using peer bud IRK configuration is by the usage of the following command: HCI_VS_LE_Fast_Connect_Debug_Set_Peer_Bud_Private_Resolvable_Address

Param.Name: Data Length
Param.Desc: Length: 0 - 31 bytes

Command.name: HCI_VS_Fast_Connect_Remove_Peer_Bud_IRK
Command.Desc: The command removes the peer bud's IRK

ExtDesc.p: This command allows to erase the peer bud pre-configured IRK from the controller

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Fast_Connect_Write_Peer_Bud_Irk
Command.Desc: Fast Connect peer bud IRK configuration command

ExtDesc.p:
This command is used to configure the peer bud IRK in order to identify its Advertise and initiate Bud-to-Bud fast connect.
This command configures the peer's bud IRK and public address.
This command should run before LE scan is enabled.

Param.Name: Peer Bud Public Address
Param.Desc: Peer Bud Device address - should be public address

Param.Name: Peer bud IRK
Param.Desc: Peer Bud 16-byte Identity Resolution Key

Event.name: HCI_VS_eSCO_Status_Event
Event.Desc: eSCO status event to indicate eSCO created, modified or removed.

ExtDesc.p:
eSCO status event to indicate eSCO created, modified or removed.
eSCO status event will be generated in the following cases:
1. Primary create a new eSCO link successfully (state is created)
2. Primary fail to create a new eSCO link (state is removed)
3. Primary existing eSCO link parameters were changed (state is modified)
4. Primary eSCO link was disconnected (state is removed)
5. Secondary snoop eSCO link was created successfully (state is created)
6. Secondary existing snoop eSCO link parameters were changed (state is modified)
7. Secondary snoop eSCO link was disconnected (state is removed)

Param.Name: State
Param.Desc: State 0 - created, 1 - modified, 2 - removed

Param.Name: DeSCO
Param.Desc: DeSCO

Param.Name: TeSCO
Param.Desc: TeSCO

Param.Name: Timing Control Flags
Param.Desc: Timing Control Flags

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: eSCO Handle

Event.name: HCI_VS_LRS_Event
Event.Desc: LRS periodic event, called when at least one channel of LRS is enabled

ExtDesc.p:
LRS event gives LRS data for all connection and local clocks the format is as follow
Free running clock count - local device free running clock (delta from previous event)[us]
Local BT clock count - local BT clock, can be skewed after chased source (delta from previous event)[us]
For each connection BT clock count (delta from previous event) - if clock count is 0 it means data was not valid i.e. connection was
establihs between measurments and full measuremnt is not ready

Param.Name: Free running clock count
Param.Desc: Free running clock delta in us

Param.Name: Local clock count
Param.Desc: local clock delta in us

Param.label: count
Param.Name: Number of Handles
Param.Desc: The number of Handles i.e. active connections

Param.Name: clock count
Param.Desc: number of us in BT clock in respect to free running

Param.Name: Self generated
Param.Desc: Define whether the event was generated locally or by peer

Event.name: HCI_VS_Calibration_Request_Event
Event.Desc: Calibration Request Event that is sent by W2 controller in order to obtain LPCLK frequency

ExtDesc.p:
BT Low power clock is implemented by Resistor-capacitor (which is affected by temperature, etc.).
Thus, it needs to be frequently recalibrated for precise configuration of BTC sleep duration.
The BTC is required to communicate with the AP in order to obtain the LPCLK Frequency (Calibration value).
The calibration request event is used by the controller to ask for the Calibration Info Command.

Param.Name: RFU
Param.Desc: Reserved for Future use

ExtDesc.p: BLE Audio Statistics event.

Param.Name: Connection handle
Param.Desc: Connection_Handle to be used to identify a connection

Param.Name: Primary events blocked by BT
Param.Desc: Number of primary events blocked by BT scheduling

Param.Name: Primary events blocked by WLAN
Param.Desc: Number of primary events blocked by WLAN

Param.Name: Primary empty LEAS Rx
Param.Desc: Number of empty LEAS Rx that were received in primary event

Param.Name: Primary LEAS Rx
Param.Desc: Number of not empty LEAS Rx that were received in primary event

Param.Name: Primary empty LEAS Tx
Param.Desc: Number of empty LEAS Tx that were send in primary events (due to LEAS Tx Q under-run)

Param.Name: Primary LEAS Tx
Param.Desc: Number of not empty LEAS packets that were transmitted in primary event

Param.Name: Primary LEAS Rx ACK
Param.Desc: Number of Acks to LEAS packets that were received in primary event

Param.Name: Primary LEAS Tx ACK
Param.Desc: Number of Acks to LEAS packets that were sent in primary event

Param.Name: Retransmission events blocked by BT
Param.Desc: Number of retransmission events blocked by BT scheduling

Param.Name: Retransmission events blocked by WLAN
Param.Desc: Number of retransmission events blocked by WLAN

Param.Name: Retransmission empty LEAS Rx
Param.Desc: Number of empty LEAS Rx that were received in retransmission event

Param.Name: Retransmission LEAS Rx
Param.Desc: Number of not empty LEAS Rx that were received in retransmission event

Param.Name: Retransmission empty LEAS Tx
Param.Desc: Number of empty LEAS Tx that were send in retransmission events (due to LEAS Tx Q under-run)

Param.Name: Retransmission LEAS Tx
Param.Desc: Number of not empty LEAS packets that were transmitted in retransmission event

Param.Name: Retransmission LEAS Rx ACK
Param.Desc: Number of Acks to LEAS packets that were received in retransmission event

Param.Name: Retransmission LEAS Tx ACK
Param.Desc: Number of Acks to LEAS packets that were sent in retransmission event

Param.Name: Requested event counter (including retransmission)
Param.Desc: Number of events that LEA tried to be scheduled (primary + retransmission)

Param.Name: Actual event counter
Param.Desc: Number of LEA events that were scheduled

Param.Name: No LEAS Tx in audio interval
Param.Desc: Number of audio intervals that LEAS was not sent or not acked by peer

Param.Name: No LEAS Rx in audio interval
Param.Desc: Number of audio intervals that LEAS was not recevied from peer

Param.Name: Bad CRC
Param.Desc: Number of events that packet was received with bad CRC

Param.Name: LLCP or L2CAP over stream
Param.Desc: Number of events that llcp of l2cap packet was sent instead of LEAS

Param.Name: Flushd due to underflow
Param.Desc: Number of packets that arrived too late from host and when received they were deprecated and flushed

Param.Name: Flushd due to no scheduling
Param.Desc: Number of packets that were flushed because LEA did not get enough scheduling time during audio interval

Param.Name: Flushd due to no ack
Param.Desc: Number of packets that slave did not acked and therefore the packet was flushed

Param.Name: Flushd due to overflow
Param.Desc: Number of packets that were flushed because LEAS data q was full (oldest packets are flushed)

ExtDesc.p: BLE Audio AWD Statistics event.

Param.Name: First HA Connection handle
Param.Desc: Connection Handle to be used to identify the connection of the first HA

Param.Name: First HA Average RSSI
Param.Desc: Average RSSI of the last session

Param.Name: First HA reTX Rate
Param.Desc: The percentage of LEAS packets that were retransmited

Param.Name: First HA Tx failure rate
Param.Desc: The percentage of Audio intervals that Tx was not transmitted

Param.Name: First HA PER
Param.Desc: The percentage of Packets that were recevied with bad crc

Param.Name: First HA Rx missing rate
Param.Desc: The percentage of Audio intervals that Rx was not transmitted

Param.Name: Second HA Connection handle
Param.Desc: Connection Handle to be used to identify the connection of the first HA

Param.Name: Second HA Average RSSI
Param.Desc: Average RSSI of the last session

Param.Name: Second HA reTX Rate
Param.Desc: The percentage of LEAS packets that were retransmited

Param.Name: Second HA Tx failure rate
Param.Desc: The percentage of Audio intervals that Tx was not transmitted

Param.Name: Second HA PER
Param.Desc: The percentage of Packets that were recevied with bad crc

Param.Name: Second HA Rx missing rate
Param.Desc: The percentage of Audio intervals that Rx was not transmitted

ExtDesc.p: AWD Statistics event 11

Param.Name: CQDDR duration of HDR 8 requests
Param.Desc: Shows the total duration in which CQDDR decided on HDR 8 ( change to or remained )

Param.Name: CQDDR duration of HDR 4 requests
Param.Desc: Shows the total duration in which CQDDR decided on HDR 8 ( change to or remained )

Param.Name: CQDDR duration of EDR 3 requests
Param.Desc: Shows the total duration in which CQDDR decided on HDR 8 ( change to or remained )

Param.Name: CQDDR duration of EDR 2 requests
Param.Desc: Shows the total duration in which CQDDR decided on HDR 8 ( change to or remained )

Param.Name: CQDDR HDR 8 requests percentage: 0% - 5%
Param.Desc: CQDDR histogram bucket that shows percentage of CQDDR request of a given modulation. The percentage is being collected in the end of session ( when connection is terminating ).

Param.Name: CQDDR HDR 8 requests percentage: 5% - 20%
Param.Desc: CQDDR histogram bucket that shows percentage of CQDDR request of a given modulation. The percentage is being collected in the end of session ( when connection is terminating ).

Param.Name: CQDDR HDR 8 requests percentage: 80% - 100%
Param.Desc: CQDDR histogram bucket that shows percentage of CQDDR request of a given modulation. The percentage is being collected in end of session ( when connection is terminating ).

Param.Name: CQDDR EDR 3 requests percentage: 0% - 5%
Param.Desc: CQDDR histogram bucket that shows percentage of CQDDR request of a given modulation. The percentage is being collected in the end of session ( when connection is terminating ).

Event.name: HCI_VS_Magnet_Statistics_Event
Event.Desc: Magnet (Transport Switch) or Magnet Everyhwhere Statistics event.

ExtDesc.p: Magnet (Transport Switch) or Magnet Everyhwhere Statistics event.

Param.Name: Clock
Param.Desc: Lower two bytes of controller bluetooth clock

Param.Name: Duration
Param.Desc: Time which this statistics VSE cover [ms]

Param.Name: Time Spent Servicing LE Connection
Param.Desc: Time spent servicing LE connection in ms (controller scheduled on LE magnet)

Param.Name: Time Spent Servicing Classic Connection
Param.Desc: Time spent servicing Classic connection in ms (controller scheduled on Classic magnet)

Param.Name: Time Spent Servicing LE non-connection events
Param.Desc: Time spent servicing LE non-connection events in ms

Param.Name: Time Spent Servicing Classic non-connection events
Param.Desc: Time spent servicing Classic non-connection events in ms

Param.Name: LE Coex Denials
Param.Desc: Total LE Coex Denials in interval count

Param.Name: Classic Coex Denials
Param.Desc: Total Classic Coex Denials in interval count

Param.Name: Classic RSSI Average
Param.Desc: Classic RSSI Average in dBm

Param.Name: LE RSSI Average
Param.Desc: LE RSSI Average in dBm

Param.Name: LE PHY Type
Param.Desc: 0x00 - 1 mbps 0x01 - 2 mbps 0x02-0xFF - Reserved

Param.Name: Total LE Successful Transmissions
Param.Desc: Number of LE successful transmissions

Param.Name: Total LE Retransmissions
Param.Desc: Number of LE retransmissions

Param.Name: Total LE Successful Receive
Param.Desc: Number of LE successful receive

Param.Name: Total LE Receive with error
Param.Desc: Number of LE receive with error (excluding no sync)

Param.Name: Classic PHY Type
Param.Desc: 0x00 - BDR 0x01 - EDR 0x02 - HDR 0x03-0xFF - Reserved

Param.Name: Total Classic Successful Transmissions
Param.Desc: Number of Classic successful transmissions

Param.Name: Total Classic Retransmissions
Param.Desc: Number of Classic retransmissions

Param.Name: Total Classic Successful Receive
Param.Desc: Number of Classic successful receive

Param.Name: Total Classic receive with error
Param.Desc: Number of Classic receive with error (excluding no sync)

Param.Name: Reason
Param.Desc: Reason for sending this event: 0x00 - Interval Elapsed 0x01 - Classic Disconnected 0x02 - LE Disconnected 0x03 - Host initiated flush or interval changed 0x04 - Counter rollover 0x05-0xFF - Reserved

Param.Name: LE Average and Minimum SNR Bins
Param.Desc: LE statistic bins of average and minimum SNR pairs. E.g. [0]: Average SNR of bin 0, [1]: Minimum SNR of bin 0, [2]: Average SNR of bin 1, [3]: Minimum SNR of bin 1, ..., etc.

Param.Name: LE Average RSSI Bins
Param.Desc: LE average RSSI statistic bins

Param.Name: LE RSSI Saturation Count Bins
Param.Desc: LE RSSI saturation count statistic bins

Param.Name: Classic RSSI Saturation Count Bins
Param.Desc: Classic RSSI saturation count statistic bins

Param.Name: Classic Average SNR Bins
Param.Desc: Classic average SNR statistic bins

Param.Name: Classic Average RSSI Bins
Param.Desc: Classic average RSSI statistic bins

Param.Name: Classic Average TX Power
Param.Desc: Classic average TX power in the last interval

Param.Name: Packet Type Count
Param.Desc: Each octet is packet count for a packet type

Param.Name: Classic Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle for the classic connection related fields

Param.Name: LE Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle for the LE connection related fields

Param.Name: Wakeup event payload version
Param.Desc: Version number for uppper layer to process payload

Param.Name: Wakeup event type
Param.Desc: Duplicate of Last BT wakeup reason below, indicates what was the reason of AP wakeup caused by BT

Param.Name: Wakeup event payload length
Param.Desc: The effective length of the payload field, no more than 60 bytes

Param.Name: Wakeup event payload
Param.Desc: Payload field

Param.Name: Last AP wakeup timestamp
Param.Desc: Timestamp of last wakeup

Param.Name: Last wakeup due to BT
Param.Desc: Indicates that last AP wakeup was caused by BT

Param.Name: Last BT wakeup reason
Param.Desc: Indicates what was the reason of AP wakeup caused by BT

Param.Name: Last Capture ID
Param.Desc: Indicates what was the last capture that woke up the AP

Param.Name: Endpoint opcode
Param.Desc: Last endpoint opcode that woke up the AP

Param.Name: HCI traffic type
Param.Desc: Last HCI traffic type the woke up the AP

Param.Name: HCI event opcode
Param.Desc: Last event opcode that woke up the AP. Relevant only if 'Layer Specific' is 5 (Tx event).

Param.Name: HCI sub event event opcode
Param.Desc: Sub event opcode. Relevant only if 'Last event opcode' was 0x3e (LE meta event)

Param.Name: Last Ring Index
Param.Desc: Last Ring Index. Relevant only if wakeup reason was general

Param.Name: Layer specific
Param.Desc: Layer specific of last event that woke up the AP

Param.Name: AP total wakeup counter
Param.Desc: Counter of total AP wakeup.

Param.Name: Counter due to BT
Param.Desc: Counter of AP sleep.

Param.Name: Counter due to capture
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to capture points

Param.Name: Counter due to PHY capture
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to PHY capture points

Param.Name: Counter due to event
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to events

Param.Name: Counter due to LMP over HCI
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to events

Param.Name: Counter due to ACL traffic
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to ACL traffic

Param.Name: Counter due to SCO traffic
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to SCO traffic

Param.Name: Counter due to LE traffic
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to LE traffic

Param.Name: Counter due to LEA traffic
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to LEA traffic

Param.Name: Counter due to traces
Param.Desc: Counts number of times the BT woke up the AP due to traces

Param.Name: Counter due to other reasons
Param.Desc: Counter that contains all wakeup reasons that are not counted above

Param.Name: Counter filtered endpoint
Param.Desc: Counts how many endpoint were skipped in order to avoid AP wakeup

Param.Name: DRAM Total statistics duration
Param.Desc: Total duration in which the statistics were collected

Param.Name: DRAM counter
Param.Desc: Counts how many times DRAM was used

Param.Name: DRAM last duration
Param.Desc: DRAM last usage duration

Param.Name: DRAM total usage duration
Param.Desc: Total duration of DRAM usage

Param.Name: Last DRAM caller ID
Param.Desc: Address (LR) of function which opened the DRAM access

Param.Name: Last DRAM caller ID (2)
Param.Desc: Address (LR) of function which opened the DRAM access - callee to callee

Param.Name: state
Param.Desc: state

Param.label: SC_command_operation
Param.Name: command_operation
Param.Desc: Defines the purpose of the command. The command can (1) set SC to enable/disable with fixed keys or (2) Currently not used

Param.Name: secure_mode
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don’t Change - load each configured and activated parameter, 0x00 - Stop AES encryption, 0x01 - Like 0xFF + LMP start encryption sent, 0x02/03/04 - Writes TX/RX/both - goes directly to HW!!!!! Any other parameter is omitted

Param.Name: handle
Param.Desc: Handle of the connection to be encrypted, 0-7 for specific handle, 0xff for not changing the handle

Param.Name: Set encryption key
Param.Desc: Copy encryption key to link manager as it was generated from SSP. 0x0-don't copy, 0x1-Copy key to link manager

Param.Name: Encryption Key
Param.Desc: Key to be used by AES encryption

Param.Name: Set b0 mode
Param.Desc: 0x0-AES mechanism will manage it automatically, 0x1-copy b0 initial to HW

Param.Name: b0 vector
Param.Desc: B0 to be used by AES encryption

Param.Name: Set b1 mode
Param.Desc: 0x0-AES mechanism will manage it automatically, 0x1-copy b1 initial value to HW

Param.Name: b1 vector
Param.Desc: B1 to be used by AES encryption

Param.Name: Set IV mode
Param.Desc: 00 - don't use 0x01 - use

Param.Name: IV
Param.Desc: IV to be used by AES encryption

Param.Name: Day Counter Value
Param.Desc: Valid values 0 or 1. FF - don't configure

Param.Name: Set payload counter mode
Param.Desc: 0x0-AES mechanism will manage it automatically, 0x1-copy payload counter initial to HW

Param.Name: Payload Counter init value
Param.Desc: Set init value of the payload counters. Set in HEX. Valid 36 bits

Param.Name: Hybrid mode enable
Param.Desc: If enabled then SC pairing will be used for E0 encryption. 0xFF for don't change.

Param.Name: Enable Inquiry Scan with max slaves
Param.Desc: Should the device be discoverable with max slaves in connection?

Param.Name: Max slave count
Param.Desc: Define the maximum amount of concurrent slaves (2 - 4)

Command.name: HCI_VS_Little_Endian_WR_BD_Addr
Command.Desc: LITTLE Endian Write local BD address.

ExtDesc.p: Write local BD address.
Event(s) generated:
When the Controller receives the write BD address command, it shall send the Command Complete event to the Host.

Param.Name: New BD Addr
Param.Desc: New BD address in little endian

Param.Name: Enable
Param.Desc: 1 - Enable HDR fature bits , 0 - Disable HDR fature bits , this command does not affect any existing connections

Param.Name: Enable
Param.Desc: 1 - Enable HDR Slave channel classifcation, 0 - Disable HDR Slave channel classifcation

Param.Name: HCI Handle
Param.Desc: The HCI handle of the connection

Param.Name: Enable
Param.Desc: Enable or disable HDR forcing

Param.Name: Single Frequency
Param.Desc: The single frequency to use

Param.Name: Packet Type
Param.Desc: The packet type to force

Param.Name: RX Interleave
Param.Desc: Enable RX de-interleaving of bytes

Param.Name: Force HDR packets
Param.Desc: Force sending HDR packets even if packet can be sent as BR or EDR (Except for DM1)

Param.Name: HDR 8
Param.Desc: Enable or disable HDR 8 local feature support

Param.Name: HDR 4
Param.Desc: Enable or disable HDR 4 local feature support

Param.Name: Interlave TX
Param.Desc: Enable or disable Interleave TX local feature support

Param.Name: Interleave RX
Param.Desc: Enable or disable Interleave RX local feature support

Param.Name: Block master set_afh
Param.Desc: Enable or disable Master set_afh blocking

Param.Name: Block slave channel classification
Param.Desc: Enable or disable slave channnel classifications

Param.Name: HCI Handle
Param.Desc: The HCI handle of the connection

Param.Name: Packet Count
Param.Desc: Number of packets to send

Param.Name: Packet Size
Param.Desc: Size of each packet

Param.Name: Drop RX Packets
Param.Desc: Drop packets on RX or not.

Param.Name: Enable
Param.Desc: Enable/disable slave ts time mesurment

Command.name: HCI_VS_Init_Done
Command.Desc: Send once at the end of the init script to trigger calibrations and apply MSF (TAC) data

ExtDesc.p: This command informs the MAC firmware in the Controller that the factory calibration data MSF (TAC) loading was done. Upon reception of this command the firmware completes the initialization process and triggers the PHY FW to execute run time calibrations using the preloaded factory calibration data MSF (TAC).
If the command is sent before factory calibration MSF (TAC) is downloaded the FW will continue with the chipset initialization using default hard coded factory calibration MSF (TAC) values.
This command SHALL be sent to the controller exactly one time after turning on the controller and before attempting to perform any functional usage of the BT system.

Param.Name: Reserved1
Param.Desc: Reserved1

Param.Name: Reserved2
Param.Desc: Reserved2

Param.Name: Reserved3
Param.Desc: Reserved3

Param.Name: Reserved4
Param.Desc: Reserved4

Group.name: HCI VS Commands in BTIP PG 1.0

Command.name: HCI_VS_Config_Acl_Data_Statistics
Command.Desc: This command configures the ACL data statistics that are printed to the logger, and if a handle is specified will return the statistics of that handle in the last interval.

Param.Name: ACL Statistics Enable
Param.Desc: Enable(1)/Disable(0) Statistics printings to the logger

Param.Name: Printings Interval
Param.Desc: Time in milisec between one logger printing to another not including sleep time. Value is clipped at 8000

Param.Name: Get Static from Handle
Param.Desc: 0xFF- Don't print,0x00-0x06 print static from the specified handle.

Param.Name: RX Result
Param.Desc: Rx rate in the last interval [Bit/sec]

Param.Name: TX Result
Param.Desc: Tx rate in the last interval [Bit/sec]

Param.Name: TX Retransmission Ratio
Param.Desc: Ratio of NACK and No-Rx packets from all Rx packets (ACK, NACK and No-Rx)

Param.Name: Rssi
Param.Desc: Averaged Rssi (-128 - 128)

Param.Name: CRC Ratio
Param.Desc: The bad CRC ratio percentage in the last interval, calculated as total bad CRC in the last interval divided by total of bad CRC plus total of good CRC. Note: Good and bad CRC are calculated only for packets with good header

Command.name: HCI_VS_Config_Voice_Statistics
Command.Desc: This command configures Voice data statistics.

ExtDesc.p: This command configures Voice data statistics.

Param.Name: Voice Statistics Enable
Param.Desc: Enable/Disable Statistics printings to the logger

Param.Name: Clear connection statistics
Param.Desc: Enable/Disable clearing of statistics gathered from the connection start

Param.Name: Printings Interval
Param.Desc: Time in milisec between one logger printing to another not including sleep time

Command.name: HCI_VS_Read_Voice_Statistics

ExtDesc.p: This command reads Voice data statistics.

Command.Desc: This command reading the voice statistics.

Param.Name: HCI OR from host in interval
HCI OR to host in interval
Consecutive voice schedule miss in interval
Max consecutive voice schedule miss in interval
Num dfc tx fifo flush in interval
HCI OR from host in connection
HCI OR to host in connection
Consecutive voice schedule miss in connection
Max consecutive voice schedule miss in connection
Num dfc tx fifo flush in connection
Qualification Mode
Param.Desc: 0x0 - Disabled, 0x1 - regular qualification mode, 0x2 manual qualification

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Enable_Trans_Switch_Reject_Mode
Command.Desc: This command enables and disables transport switching reject if received during another transaction. Disabled by default.

Param.Name: Enable
Param.Desc: 0x0 - Disabled, bit 0 for channel map update, bit 1 for connection update

Param.Name: PA Configuration
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; bit0 - PA off polarity (0 = Active Low)

Param.Name: TX_mode
Param.Desc: Configures the TX mode

Param.Name: RX_mode
Param.Desc: Configures the RX mode

Param.Name: Connection handle select
Param.Desc: 0x0-0xEFF - select the connection handle; 0xF000 - Disable priority on all handles; 0xFFFF - Don't change

Param.Name: Connection handle enable
Param.Desc: 0 - Disable; 1- Enable

Param.Name: Freq_mask_enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Do not change; 0x0 - No Freq mask; 0x1 - Enable freq mask on WLAN 0; 0x2 - Enable freq mask on WLAN 1; 0x3 - Enable freq mask on WLAN0 and WLAN1

Param.Name: Freq mask
Param.Desc: Frequency mask

Param.Name: WLAN013_BT_IP_selected_pin
Param.Desc: ORCA Only 0: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 on the FM_I2S i/f ports, WLAN0 on FM_I2S_DI, WLAN1 on FM_I2S_WS, WLAN3 on FM_I2S_DO 1: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 on the FM I2C i/f ports, WLAN0 on FM_IRQ, WLAN1 on FM_SDA, WLAN3 on FM_SCL 2: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 as seen below, WLAN0 on BT_FUNC2, WLAN1 on BT_FUNC1, WLAN3 on FM_I2S_DO NL5500+1270 3: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 as seen below, WLAN0 on FM_SDA/BT_FUNC4, WLAN1 on FM_IRQ/BT_FUNC5, WLAN3 on BT_GPIO5/BT_FUNC7 NL5500 4: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 as seen below, WLAN0 on BT_GPIO2/BT_FUNC4, WLAN1 on BT_GPIO4/BT_FUNC6, WLAN3 on BT_GPIO5/BT_FUNC7 5: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 as seen below, WLAN0 on FM_SDA/BT_FUNC4, WLAN1 on FM_I2S_CLK/BT_FUNC6, WLAN3 on FM_I2S_FSYNC/BT_FUNC7 Quattro 6: Mux WLAN0, WLAN1 and WLAN3 as seen below, WLAN0 on BT_FUNC5, WLAN1 on BT_FUNC6, WLAN3 on BT_FUNC7

Param.Name: WLAN2_BT_IP_selected_pin
Param.Desc: 0: Mux WLAN2 on the FM_I2S_CLK port, 1: Mux WLAN2 on the CLK_REQ_OUT Not Used For NL5500 and Quattro

Param.Name: Wlan0 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled. For Quattro: 00 => IP pull control (default). 01 => Pull Up. 10 => Pull down. 11 => Pull disabled.

Param.Name: Wlan1 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled. For Quattro: 00 => IP pull control (default). 01 => Pull Up. 10 => Pull down. 11 => Pull disabled.

Param.Name: Wlan2 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled. Not supported for QUATTRO

Param.Name: Wlan3 pull enable
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change; 0 - Pull set by IP, 1 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is disabled; 2 - Input pull (on selected input IO) is enabled For Quattro: 00 => IP pull control (default). 01 => Pull Up. 10 => Pull down. 11 => Pull disabled.

Param.Name: Disable WLAN
Param.Desc: 0x0 - Don't do anything; 0x1 - Disable WLAN;; 0x2 - Enable BT mechanism for NL5500 +1270

Command.name: HCI_VS_Config_A2dp_Rssi_Threshold
Command.Desc: Configure the high priority threshold (A2DP) so as to try to avoid a temporary loss
Command.ExtDesc: Configure the high priority threshold, potentially responding to a sudden drop in received power.

Param.Name: a2dp_rssi_threshold
Param.Desc: Indicates the floor threshold under which the power algorithm will conclude that there's an urgent need to go to maximum internal power level

Param.Name: Type
Param.Desc: 0 - Read Current Transmit Power Level, 1 - Read Maximum Transmit Power Level

Param.Name: Transmit Power Level GFSK
Param.Desc: dBm

Param.Name: Transmit Power Level DQPSK
Param.Desc: dBm

Param.Name: Transmit Power Level 8DPSK
Param.Desc: dBm

Param.Name: Transmit Power Level HDR4
Param.Desc: dBm

Param.Name: Transmit Power Level HDR8
Param.Desc: dBm

Param.Name: Enable flag
Param.Desc: When set to 1, indicates enabling of power management algorithm

Param.Name: rssi_thl_acl (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_thl_sco (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_thl_edr3 (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_thh_acl (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_thh_sco (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_thh_edr3 (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_vhth (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_vhth_edr3 (dBm)
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_th_sensitivity
Param.Desc: 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: snr_thl
Param.Desc: 0 - disable SNR condition. 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: snr_edr3_thl
Param.Desc: 0 - disable SNR condition. 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: snr_thh
Param.Desc: 0 - disable SNR condition. 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: snr_edr3_thh
Param.Desc: 0 - disable SNR condition. 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: bad_sync_count_th_sco
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: fec_min_headers_acl
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: fec_min_headers_sco
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: fec_ratio_thl_acl
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: fec_ratio_thh_acl
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: fec_ration_thl_sco
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: fec_ration_thh_sco
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: fec_min_bits_acl
Param.Desc: 0x8000(-32768):Don't change

Param.Name: fec_min_bits_sco
Param.Desc: 0x8000(-32768):Don't change

Param.Name: crc_ratio_thl_acl
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: crc_ratio_thh_acl
Param.Desc: 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: min_pkts_acl
Param.Desc: Minimum number of packets to calculate CRC statistics. 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: min_pkts_sco
Param.Desc: Minimum number of packets to calculate CRC statistics. 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: power_decision_time
Param.Desc: The interval, in which a decision is made whether to increase/decrease or not to change peer tx power (decision interval = power_decision_time x100ms). 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: power_acl_response_time
Param.Desc: On ACL channel the minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to increase power (delay interval = power_decision_time x power_response_time x 100ms). 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: power_sco_response_time
Param.Desc: On E/SCO channel the minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to increase power (delay interval = power_decision_time x power_response_time x 100ms). 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: power_edr3_response_time
Param.Desc: On EDR3 channel the minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to increase power (delay interval = power_decision_time x power_response_time x 100ms). 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: power_delay_time
Param.Desc: The minimal delay between the last command requested to increase power or decrease to the command request to decrease power (delay interval = power_delay_time x power_decision_time x 100ms). 0xFF:Don't change

Param.Name: deep_fade_rssi_delta1 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the previews measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-1]). 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: deep_fade_rssi_delta2 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the one before the preview measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-2]). 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: deep_fade_edr3_rssi_delta1 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the previews measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-1]. 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: deep_fade_edr3_rssi_delta2 (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi threshold between current measure and the one before the preview measure to make decision if we in deep fade.(delta2 = rssi[N] - rssi[N-2]). 0x80(-128):Don't change

Param.Name: rssi_a2dp_thl (dBm)
Param.Desc: rssi low threshold triggering setting local power to max on active A2DP connections. 0x7F(-127):Disable, 0x80(-128):Don't Change

Param.Name: Enable by host
Param.Desc: Generic host CQDDR enable. 0=Disabled 1=Enabled 0xFF=Don't change. If not enabled, all acl won't support CQDDR

Param.Name: Enable algorithm
Param.Desc: 0 - Enable, 1 - Disable, 0xFF - don't change. Enable/Disable per lm handle.

Param.Name: Ignore CQDDR peer requests
Param.Desc: 0 - Don't ignore, 1 - Ignore, 0xFF - don't change.

Param.Name: Connection handle
Param.Desc: Connextion handle in which you would like to enable/disable.

Param.Name: Minimum packets required to change state
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, Minimum packets that are required to conclude CQDDR state. Above this number packet type ratio will be calculated and CQDDR state will be updated accordingly (if required).

Param.Name: cqddr_min_packets_ratio_percentage
Param.Desc: Ratio in percent, 0xFF - Don't change. Packets percentage above this ratio will be considered as dominate and thus influencing CQDDR state.

Param.Name: bad crc ratio edr3 to edr2 max slot 1 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. In case of max slot 1, above this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use EDR2 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: bad crc ratio edr2 to edr3 max slot 1 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. In case of max slot 1, below this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use EDR3 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: bad crc ratio edr3 to edr2 max slot 3 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. In case of max slot 3, above this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use EDR2 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: bad crc ratio edr2 to edr3 max slot 3 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. In case of max slot 3, below this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use EDR3 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: bad crc ratio edr3 to edr2 max slot 5 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. In case of max slot 5, above this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use EDR2 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: bad crc ratio edr2 to edr3 max slot 5 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. In case of max slot 5, below this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use EDR3 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: EDR3 to EDR2 counter threshold
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Dont' change. Defines how many time EDR3 to EDR2 condition is being fulfill in a raw before requesting to change to EDR2

Param.Name: EDR2 to EDR3 counter threshold
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Dont' change. Defines how many time EDR2 to EDR3 condition is being fulfill in a raw before requesting to change to EDR3

Param.Name: bad crc ratio HDR8 to HDR4 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. Above this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use HDR4 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: bad crc ratio HDR4 to HDR8 thr
Param.Desc: -128 - Dont' change. Below this bad CRC threshold CQDDR may request to use HDR8 (corresponding to the relevant counter threshold) .

Param.Name: HDR8 to HDR4 counter threshold
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Dont' change. Defines how many time HDR8 to HDR4 condition is being fulfill in a raw before requesting to change to HDR4

Param.Name: HDR4 to HDR8 counter threshold
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Dont' change. Defines how many time EDR4 to HDR8 condition is being fulfill in a raw before requesting to change to HDR8

Param.Name: Minimum packets required for bad CRC ratio
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Dont' change. Defines the minimum packets that required to take in account bad CRC rate

Param.Name: CQDDR debug level
Param.Desc: Defines printing debug level. 0-no debug level, 1..5 or 0xFF - Dont' change. Setting it to max (5) includes all CQDDR debug printing

Param.Name: Enable flag
Param.Desc: 0=Disabled 1=Enabled.

Param.Name: Priority
Param.Desc: 0 - Low Priority (BEST_EFFORT), 1 - High Priority (GUARANTEED)

Param.Name: sleep enable bit mask
Param.Desc: If apply bit is off ignore other bits, If apply bit is on than '1' enable an option, '0' disable an option.

Param.Name: big sleep timer
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - isn't allowed, Otherwise big sleep timer in frames, define maximum time of big sleep.

Param.Name: Time to wakeup
Param.Desc: 0xFFFF - Don't change, Time to wakeup in [us] before actual time of any given activity.

Param.Name: Back off time
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, Otherwise define time (in frames) to block sleep when last WU source was HCI command.

Param.Name: Skip slow-fast transition
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - Perform fast to slow transition during sleep. Otherwise - Skip slow to fast transition during sleep.

Param.Name: Skip phy sleep
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - sleep flow will power off PHY, Otherwise - Sleep flow will skip powering off the PHY

Param.Name: SWD Top power gate
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - Set SOC to clock gate during sleep, Otherwise - PHY domain remains on during sleep.

Param.Name: Enable sleep statistics
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - Disable sleep statistics, Otherwise - Enable sleep statistics.

Param.Name: LE sleep optimization
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - Disable LE optimization, Otherwise - How many frames before LE activity start.

Param.Name: Sniff master sleep optimization
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - Disable sniff slave optimization, Otherwise - How many frames before slave sniff activity start.

Param.Name: Sniff slave sleep optimization
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Don't change, 0 - Disable sniff slave optimization, Otherwise - How many frames before slave sniff activity start.

Param.Name: Output Mode
Param.Desc: Clock Sharing Output Mode

Param.Name: Pattern Detection Enable
Param.Desc: 0 - disable, 1 - enable

Param.Name: Pattern Detection Window size
Param.Desc: length of the pattern window

Param.Name: Pattern Detection Errors within window
Param.Desc: number of error that will be fixed

Param.Name: Pattern Detection Margin
Param.Desc: Good channels that will be removed from each margin

Param.Name: CCM sample period
Param.Desc: How many times CCM is update before reading CCM results (unit of 25mS)

Param.Name: Accumulate threshold
Param.Desc: How many times CCM results are read before processing data (units of "CCM sample period")

Param.Name: Min hits th 1
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is above "TH switch RSSI": Minimal number of HEC events for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests)

Param.Name: Good HEC percent TH 1
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is above "TH switch RSSI":Percentage of good HEC for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests)

Param.Name: Min SNR th 1
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is above "TH switch RSSI":Minimal PHY SNR for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests), in dB

Param.Name: Min hits th 2
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is below "TH switch RSSI": Minimal number of HEC events for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests)

Param.Name: Good HEC percent TH 2
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is below "TH switch RSSI":Percentage of good HEC for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests), in percent

Param.Name: Min SNR th 2
Param.Desc: When minimal RSSI is below "TH switch RSSI":Minimal PHY SNR for channel not to be considered as bad (if less than TH it is bad, otherwise check other tests), in dB

Param.Name: TH switch RSSI
Param.Desc: RSSI level at which other thresholds are switched, in dBm

Param.Name: HV1 return channel threshold
Param.Desc: minimal number of good channels allowed in HV1, when reaching this number all channels are returned

Param.Name: HV1 return timer
Param.Desc: time in seconds for channel return in HV1 (stand alone timer, not restarted at channel drop)

Param.Name: Random Seed
Param.Desc: Generated by Host, random seed

Command.name: HCI_VS_Configure_afh_channel_classification
Command.ExtDesc:
This procedure is designated to override the wlan channel classification behavior.
User may modify part or all parameters

Param.label: CFG_TYPE
Param.Name: AFH configuration type
Param.Desc: AFH configuration. 0 - wlan channel classification, 1 - bt channel decision

Param.Name: short_window_size
Param.Desc: Short window - number of patterns in the quick reaction observation window 1..7 (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: long_window_size
Param.Desc: Long window - number of patterns in the long reaction observation window 1..7 (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: short_window_grade_threshold
Param.Desc: Short window grade threashold - accumulated short window grade threshold. If the accumulated short window grade exceeds the theshold it's accounted for and may impact decision. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: weight_for_short
Param.Desc: Short window weight - the additional weight given to the short window. This impacts the value given to the latests observation as oposed to the long term. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: peak_to_floor
Param.Desc: Peak to floor - the distance between the sampled peak rssi and the considered noise floor. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: deviation
Param.Desc: Deviation - valid standard (delta) deviation from the average observed rssi in a wifi channel. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: minimal_samples_in_range
Param.Desc: Minimal number of samples expected to be within a deviation distance in a valid wifi channel. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: deviation_reaction
Param.Desc: Reaction - expected behavior when samples are outside the valid standard deviation. 0 - low to floor, high to floor. 1 - low to floor, high to average . (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: min_channel_energy
Param.Desc: Minimal observed energy. Energy is estimated by accumulating the difference between observed samples and the evaluate noise floor. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: min_energy_ratio
Param.Desc: Minimal expected ratio R (precent) below which the observed energy is not considered a wifi channel. Accumulated_energy (over channels within wifi) is compared with ratio*max_within_wifi*width. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: rssi_alpha_factor
Param.Desc: RSSI alpha factor is used to estimate the observed wifi channel strength, giving weight for the recent observations. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: channel_remove_grade_threshold
Param.Desc: Grade threshold - the lowest grade above which a wifi channel may be considered an interferer. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: minimum_number_bt_channels
Param.Desc: The minimal number of bt channels the algorithm is expected to keep when evaluating an AFH map. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: channel_hold_back_duration
Param.Desc: Hold back duration - Number of patterns a wifi channel may be held as an interferer even when not interfering. (0xFF implies no change)

Param.Name: Clock Sharing Output Mode
Param.Desc: 0 - disable, 1 - enable

Param.Name: Output pull enable
Param.Desc: 0 - disable, 1 - enable, 2 - default pull, 0xFF - No change

Param.Name: Pull configuration
Param.Desc: 0-pull down; 1-pull up;

Param.Name: TCXO LDO state
Param.Desc: 0-disable; 1-enable;

Param.Name: I2C offset
Param.Desc: Offset of I2C device to write

Param.Name: Value to write
Param.Desc: Value to write into offset

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: I2C offset

Param.Name: Value
Param.Desc: I2C Value

Param.Name: I2C offset
Param.Desc: Offset of I2C device to write

Param.Name: offset
Param.Desc: I2C offset

Param.Name: Value
Param.Desc: I2C Value

Param.Name: reserved1 u8
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: start Channel to print
Param.Desc: Start Channel for which grade and C2I will be printed (if bit in mask is high)

Param.Name: num of Channels to print
Param.Desc: num of Channel (from start channel and up) for which grade and C2I will be printed (if bit in mask is high)

Param.Name: reserved2 uint8
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: reserved3 uint8
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: reserved uint8
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: reserved4 uint8
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: reserved5 uint16
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: Opcode
Param.Desc: Changes Sniff FBF Scheduling Parameters

Param.Name: Sniff Instance Limit
Param.Desc: Number of frames to limit a sniff instance

Param.Name: Sniff Voice Override Threshold
Param.Desc: Number of frames sniff could not schedule before overriding voice

Param.Name: Sniff Timeout Limit
Param.Desc: Number of frames to limit a sniff timeout

Param.Name: No voice override (by slave)period in bad voice scenario
Param.Desc: Number of Frames that there will be no override of voice in bad voice scenario

Param.Name: Disable Voice Override Period
Param.Desc: The number of frames the slave will override voice for sending ACL data

Param.Name: Multislot configuration in Bad Voice Scenario
Param.Desc: The length of slave data packets used to override voice: 0x0 - single slot, 0x1 - 3-slot packets, 0x2 - 5 slot packets

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.Name: BE access percentage
Param.Desc: 0-100: Percentage of Page or Inq to sacrifice for BE ACL

Param.Name: Guaranteed access percentage
Param.Desc: 0-100: Percentage of Page or Inq to sacrifice for guaranteed ACL

Param.Name: Poll period
Param.Desc: Poll period to be requested by slave ACL during DDIP (0x02 - 0xFF)

Param.Name: Slave Wait After Tx Boundary
Param.Desc: A number of frames for ACK reception after the slave transmitted packet (0x02 - 0xFF)

Param.Name: Slave Master Search Boundary
Param.Desc: The maximal number of frames in which the slave is searching for the master during DDIP (0x02 - 0xFF)

Param.Name: Master Burst After Rx Enable
Param.Desc: Allows a following the Rx frame to be allocated to the same connection

Param.Name: Master Burst After Rx Limit
Param.Desc: Limits a number of frames after Rx

Param.Name: High Bandwidth (A2DP) Sniff access percentage
Param.Desc: 0-100: Percentage of Page or Inq to sacrifice for High Bandwidth (A2DP) Sniff

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.Name: Poll Override Threshold
Param.Desc: The Minimum number of poll intervals needed before overriding voice

Param.Name: Nulls Allocated for RX Data
Param.Desc: The number of NULL packets sent to peer after a data packet is received: 0-255.

Param.Name: Slave Search Timeout
Param.Desc: The maximum number of frames slave will wait for Poll/Null from master before giving up

Param.Name: Slave Ack Timeout
Param.Desc: The maximum number of frames slave will wait for ACK after data transmission

Param.Name: Master Burst After Rx Enable
Param.Desc: Master Burst After Rx Enable

Param.Name: Master Burst After Rx Limit
Param.Desc: Master Burst After Rx Limit

Param.Name: Best Effort Percentage
Param.Desc: Best Effort Percentage that shall be provided to Connection

Command.name: HCI_VS_FEC_Change_Request_Enable_Disable
Command.Desc: Disable or Enable FEC for a connection handle

Param.Name: action
Param.Desc: 0-disable, 1-enable

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: The ACL connection handle

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_Enable_RF_Calibration_Enhanced
Command.Desc: Configure and trigger init and periodic calibrations
Command.ExtDesc:
Enable RF Calibrations run immediately or periodically. Detect between 2 different calibration types: Init calibration, Periodic Calibration
Define the calibration procedures needed to run each time the periodic calibration run. When enabling the periodic run, the calibration should start run immediately if in standby mode.

Param.label: Calib_type_label
Param.Name: Mode
Param.Desc: 0 Init calibration , 1 Periodic calibration

Param.Name: Periodic Options
Param.Desc: 0x01-0xFB: Period length (x10 Secs),0xFC: 300 ms interval ,0xFD: one second interval , 0xFE: Keep periodic calibration, 0xFF: Stop periodic calibration.

Param.Name: Calibration Procedures Selection
Param.Desc: 0x00000000-0xFFFFFFFF: Procedures bitmap, 0xFFFFFFFF: Keep last bitmap.

Param.Name: Override Temp Condition
Param.Desc: 0x00: Run selected calibrations only if temp range changed, 0x01: Run selected calibrations regardless of temp range changes

Param.Name: RX ACTIVITY
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: RX SYNC
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: TX ACTIVITY
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: AFH ACTIVITY

Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: TX SD IRQ

Param.Name: RX SD IRQ
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: SCAN SUSPEND IRQ
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: BT2PHY IRQ
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: COEX PHY_IND
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: RX READY INDICATION
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: SPARE 2
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: SPARE 3
Param.Desc: ARMIO to toggle - 0-17, 0xFF - Disable.

Param.Name: Enable/Disable
Param.Desc: Enable/Disable test. 1 - enable. 0 - disable

Param.Name: Command 1
Param.Desc: Command to execute. 0xFF: do not execute command

Param.Name: delay 1
Param.Desc: delay to next command in usec

Param.Name: Command 2
Param.Desc: Command to execute. 0xFF: do not execute command

Param.Name: delay 2
Param.Desc: delay to next command in usec

Param.Name: Command 3
Param.Desc: Command to execute. 0xFF: do not execute command

Param.Desc: delay to next command in usec

Param.Name: Command 4
Param.Desc: Command to execute. 0xFF: do not execute command

Param.Name: delay 4
Param.Desc: delay to next command in usec

Param.Name: Loop on commands
Param.Desc: Time between to sequences of command executions. 0 - single run

Command.name: HCI_VS_Country_Code_Sel
Command.Desc: Country code selection. The VS command receives the country code and loads the phy the matched power table.

Param.Name: Region
Param.Desc: Indicates The region . 0x00 - 0x07 Country code

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_BLE_Power_Level_Load
Command.Desc: Configure the ble power levels
Command.ExtDesc:
Replace the current BLE power level vector.
Value shall be given in dBm, in fixed point notation <6.1s>
E.G. -20 represented by 0xD8 13.5 represented by 0x1B

Param.Name: cell on indication
Param.Desc: indicate the power vector for override

Param.Name: HIGH PA on indexes
Param.Desc: HIGH PA on indexes. bit "1" high refers to power level index 1 EPA is on, etc...

Param.Name: BLE reserved 0
Param.Desc: level use currently unspecified

Param.Name: BLE reserved 1
Param.Desc: level use currently unspecified

Param.Name: BLE reserved 2
Param.Desc: level use currently unspecified

Param.Name: BLE LELR Advertise
Param.Desc: The target power level for Long Range advertise

Param.Name: BLE LE 1M Advertise power level
Param.Desc: The target power level for 1M advertise

Param.Name: BLE Connection LE LR rate 1/8 power level
Param.Desc: target power level for Long range coding rate 1/8

Param.Name: BLE Connection LE LR rate 1/2 power level
Param.Desc: target power level for Long range coding rate 1/2

Param.Name: BLE Connection 2M power level
Param.Desc: target power level for BLE connection at rate 2M

Param.Name: BLE Connection 1M power level
Param.Desc: target power level for BLE connection at rate 2M

Param.Name: BLE 1M and LELR power level
Param.Desc: target power level for BLE 1M and LELR

Param.Name: BLE 2M power level
Param.Desc: target power level for BLE 2M

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_REGULATORY_Power_Table_Load

Command.ExtDesc:

The table is derived from the regulation and the specific device RF CZ

E.G. -20 represented by 0xD8 13.5 represented by 0x1B

Region BDR EDR LE Data LE Adv

CCx iPA . . . .
CCx ePA . . . .
CC7 iPA q r s t
CC7 ePA u v w x

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_REGULATORY_Power_Table_Read_V2
Command.Desc: Replace the current Regulatory table dimensions: [num_country_code*num_power_amplifiers]x[BDR,EDR,LE_D,LE_ADV]
Command.ExtDesc:
Read a column in the current Regulatory table
The table is derived from the regulation and the device RF CZ
Value shall be given in dBm, in fixed point notation <6.1s>
E.G. -20 represented by 0xD8 13.5 represented by 0x1B
REGULATORY table structure
Region BDR EDR HDR4 HDR8 BLE BLE 2M BLE ADV BLE 2M ADV
CC0 iPA a i . . . . p x
CC0 ePA b j . . . . q y
CC1 iPA c k . . . . r z
CC1 ePA d l . . . . s a'
CCx iPA e m . . . . t b'
CCx ePA f n . . . . u c'
CC7 iPA g o . . . . v d'
CC7 ePA h z . . . . w e'

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_High_Power_Enable
Command.Desc: Enable high power (External Power Amplifier)
Command.ExtDesc:
Enable high power (External Power Amplifier)
following this command the internal power may use the external power amplifier
conditions for high power are:
enable-set
measured received rssi is less than rssi_threshold assuming rssi controlled high power
nack ratio has exceeded the high nack ratio threshold assuming nack ratio controlled high power
reached internal max_power_index
peer has reached its max power

Param.Name: high_power_control_mode
Param.Desc: Controls whether or not HP is enabled and under which control policy

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Connection hci handle

Param.Name: RSSI Threshold
Param.Desc: RSSI Threshold absolute value

Param.Name: NACK ratio threshold high
Param.Desc: ratio above which will enter high power mode (assuming nack control policy)

Param.Name: NACK ratio threshold low
Param.Desc: ratio below which will exit high power mode (assuming nack control policy)

Command.name: HCI_VS_Power_Control_Set_Debug_State
Command.Desc: Power Control normally controlled by algorithm, this allows holding back the power algorithm
Command.ExtDesc:
This allows holding back the power algorithm.
Power Control is normally controlled by algorithm,

Param.Name: debug_state
Param.Desc: 0 stands for normal, 1 stands for debug in which power control algorithm is disabled

Command.Desc: Set the current power level (assuming power control is in debug mode)
Command.ExtDesc: Set the current power level (assuming power control is in debug mode).

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle

Param.Name: power_level
Param.Desc: Indicates The requested power level

Command.name: HCI_VS_Power_Control_Set_Bidirectional_Max_Power_Mode
Command.Desc: Force power to max power on both sides. (by setting the local power of the connection and requesting the peer to increase power to max)
Command.ExtDesc: Force power to max power on both sides. (by setting the local power of the connection and requesting the peer to increase power to max).

Param.Desc: Connection handle

Param.Name: power_control_override
Param.Desc: Indicates whether or not to override the power control with maximum power

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_Power_Level_Load
Command.ExtDesc:
NOTE: This command is not final and is expected to change in the near future The transmit power control algorithm is based on the capability to construct power control word for any required power level, based on pre-known ACW and interpolating the required control.
This VS command allows us to define the desired power vector for each modulation scheme, as well as determining whether a specific power requires activation of an external PA (in Class1 case).
Value shall be given in dBm, in fixed point notation <6.1s>. When configuring power tables a command should be sent for each modulation type.
The power tables will be kept on DRAM in advance for all the supported modes. For power control feature debug MAC shall support power tables load through hci. The command can also be used to replace the tables on the DRAM with other tables.
The power tables load command on MAC triggers an a-sync api command to phy for power tables load.
MAC support receiving the power load command at any point including during active connection.
W2 does not support external PA indexes and they should all be 0.

Param.Name: Cellular on indication
Param.Desc: Indicate whether cellular is on or off. 0 - cell off, 1 - cell on

Param.Name: Advertising power
Param.Desc: Advertising power. Relevant only for LE Modulation. Replaces index 0 in LE mode

Param.label: EDR2
Param.Name: EDR2 Power Table
Param.Desc: EDR2 power table. 0 - takes default values, 1 - takes filled values

Param.Name: External PA on indexes
Param.Desc: External PA on indexes. bit "1" high refers to power level index 1 HP is on, etc...

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_Power_Level_Load_V2
Command.ExtDesc:
The transmit power control algorithm is based on the capability to construct power control word for any required power level, based on pre-known ACW and interpolating the required control.
This VS command allows us to define the desired power vector for a given modulation.
Value shall be given in dBm, in fixed point notation <6.1s>. When configuring a power table a command should be sent for each modulation type.
For power control feature debug MAC shall support power tables load through hci.
The power tables load command on MAC triggers an a-sync api command to phy for power tables load.
MAC support receiving the power load command at any point including during active connection.
W2 does not support external PA indexes and they should all be 0.

Param.label: Modulation
Param.Name: Modulation Power Table
Param.Desc: Modulation type the following vector is associated to. EDR, BDR, BLE, HDR4 or HDR8

Param.Name: External PA on indexes
Param.Desc: External PA on indexes. bit "1" high refers to power level index 1 HP is on, etc...

Param.Desc: power table index 0 value
