ExtDesc.p: Note: This command is kept for compatibility but it’s use in new scripts or software is not encouraged. Instead HCI_VS_Sweep_Con_TX should be used with Freq. Step Value = 0.

This command is used to test the RF transceiver in continuous transmission mode. Activation of the transmitter is done by configuring the transmission parameters and commanding the PHY CPU to run a Tx Start script. The script also enables generating a user defined pattern (or correcting definitions without a patch) by setting new PN init value and mask.

Important: unlike normal connection, the PHY configuration does not take place in the MAC, and instead the transmitter parameters are set by the VS command itself (PN generators, frequency, etc...), directly to the registers.
In PLT IF Testing the following configuration is recommended:

Modulation Scheme = 0 (CW)
Test Pattern = 0 (PN9)
Frequency = 2402MHz
Generator Init Value = 0
EDR Generator Mask Value = 0

Param.Name: Modulation Scheme
Param.Desc: Modulation Scheme

Param.Name: Test Pattern
Param.Desc: Test Pattern

Param.Name: Power level index
Param.Desc: Range 0-10 : 10=Max Output Power, 0=Min Output Power. keep in mind value is written as is, make sure not to write illegal values

Param.Name: Generator Init Value
Param.Desc: 0x00000000..0x00FFFFFF: Generator Init Value used in User Defined Pattern Only (for GFSK and EDR)

Param.Name: EDR Generator Mask Value
Param.Desc: 0x00000000..0x00FFFFFF: EDR Generator Mask Value used in User Defined Pattern Only (for EDR only)

ExtDesc.p: This command is used to test the RF transceiver in continuous transmission mode. Activation of the transmitter is done by configuring the transmission parameters and commanding the PHY CPU to run a Tx Start script. The script also enables generating a user defined pattern (or correcting definitions without a patch) by setting new PN init value and mask.

Important: unlike normal connection, the PHY configuration does not take place in the MAC, and instead the transmitter parameters are set by the VS command itself (PN generators, frequency, etc...), directly to the registers.
This command extends the legacy HCI_VS_Con_TX with the ability to sweep the BT band with a specified Tx time in each frequency.
Freq. Start::Step::Stop – give the ability to sweep wanted frequencies from the start value to the stop value in step value resolution. [value in MHz].
Start, Stop Default = 2402
Step Default = 0, means stay on the same frequency

When sweeping over frequencies the Tx is done in pulses. The active Tx time in each frequency and the inactive time between them has a minimum constant time of ~100us each. If the exact length of this basic pulse width is critical to the test it should be measured accurately with the specific FW version used as MAC or PHY changes might slightly impact it (in the order of several us).
The pulses width (active and inactive) can be extended using:
Dwell Time – Specifies the amount of time to transmit in each frequency beyond the constant minimal transmission duration [value in usec].
Default = 0xFFFFFFFF, means unlimited.
Stop Time – Specifies the amount of inactivity time between transmissions beyond the constant minimal inactivity duration [value in usec].
In case that the Freq. Stop <=Freq. Start or Dwell == 0xFFFFFFF, there would be no sweep in frequency but a continuous transmission of unlimited time on the start frequency.
In the case that Freq. Step == 0 and Dwell != 0xFFFFFFFF there there would be no sweep in frequency but a single transmission of the requested dwell time on the start frequency.

Otherwise, the command will transmit the requested dwell time at each frequency and move to the next frequency until all requested frequencies finished. After all freq. were finished the command will stop the TX and return the MAC/PHY to default state (operational)

Param.Name: Modulation Scheme
Param.Desc: Modulation Scheme

Param.Name: Test Pattern
Param.Desc: Test Pattern

Param.Name: Power level index
Param.Desc: Range 0-10 : 10=Max Output Power, 0=Min Output Power. keep in mind value is written as is, make sure not to write illegal values

Param.Name: Generator Init Value
Param.Desc: 0x00000000..0x00FFFFFF: Generator Init Value used in User Defined Pattern Only (for GFSK and EDR)

Param.Name: EDR Generator Mask Value
Param.Desc: 0x00000000..0x00FFFFFF: EDR Generator Mask Value used in User Defined Pattern Only (for EDR only)

Param.Name: Dwell Time
Param.Desc: Dwell Time – Specifies the amount of time to transmit at a specific frequency [UINT32 in usec]. Default = 0xFFFFFFFF, means unlimited time

Param.Name: Stop Time
Param.Desc: Stop Time – Specifies the amount of time between each step [UINT32 in usec]. Default = 0xFFFFFFFF, means no steps

Param.Name: Freq. Start Value
Param.Desc: Freq. Start::Step::Stop – give the ability to sweep wanted frequencies from the start value to the stop value in step value resolution. [value in MHz, step size is UINT].

Param.Name: Freq. Stop Value
Param.Desc: Freq. Start::Step::Stop – give the ability to sweep wanted frequencies from the start value to the stop value in step value resolution. [value in MHz, step size is UINT].

Param.Name: Freq. Step Value
Param.Desc: Freq. Start::Step::Stop – give the ability to sweep wanted frequencies from the start value to the stop value in step value resolution. [value in MHz, step size is UINT].Step Default = 0, means stay on the same frequency

ExtDesc.p: This command gets the BT channel index and ADPLL mode and sets the device to continuous reception.

Important: unlike normal connection, the PHY configuration does not take place in the MAC, and instead the receiver parameters are set by the VS command itself (PN generators, frequency, etc...), directly to the registers.

Param.Name: RX mode
Param.Desc: Choose the RX Mode to Use: 0- Connection Mode, 1- Best RF Mode (ADPLL Closed Loop), 2- Low Current Mode (ADPLL Open Loop), 3- Scan Mode

Param.Name: Modulation type
Param.Desc: Receiver modulation type, determines if BT RX START, BLE RX START or OTHER_IP RX START are given

ExtDesc.p: This command triggers generation of packets TX and/or RX sequences with configurable transmission parameters.
The configuration is set by the MAC I/F to the PHY, and so the packets are created same way as normal connection, only by different MAC input parameters (and not necessary according to BB data).
The “number of packets” parameter enables to run finite/Infinite number of packets

Param.Name: ACL TX Packet Type
Param.Desc: ACL TX Packet Type

Param.Name: Frequency Mode
Param.Desc: 0 - Hopping, 3 - Single freq.

Param.Name: TX Single Frequency
Param.Desc: 2402 - 2480 MHz, 0xFFFF no TX

Param.Name: RX Single Frequency
Param.Desc: 2402 - 2480 MHz, 0xFFFF no RX

Param.Name: ACL TX Packet Data Pattern
Param.Desc: ACL TX Packet Data Pattern

Param.Name: reserved
Param.Desc: no description

Param.Name: Power level index
Param.Desc: Range 0-10 : 10=Max Output Power, 0=Min Output Power. keep in mind value is written as is, make sure not to write illegal values

Param.Name: Disable whitening
Param.Desc: 0=Enable whitening, 1=Disable whitening

Param.Name: PRBS9 Init Value
Param.Desc: 0x0000-0x01FF: PRBS9 Init Value (Used only in PRBS9 patterns)

Param.Name: Number of packets
Param.Desc: Specifies the number of packets to transmit at a specific frequency [UINT32]. Default = 0xFFFFFFFF, means unlimited number of packets.

ExtDesc.p:
This command is based on the Packet TX/RX command. It enables to determine the packet’s transmission parameters and gives the ability to run it over frequency range sweep.
The command transmits the requested number of packets at each frequency and move to the next frequency according to the step value until all of requested frequencies are finished.

The following Regular Packet TX/RX parameters are fixed:
Frequency Mode – Single Freq. , 0x3
RX Single Frequency – No Rx, 0xFFFF

Param.Name: Number of packets
Param.Desc: Specifies the number of packets to transmit at a specific frequency [UINT32]. Default = 0xFFFFFFFF, means unlimited number of packets.

Param.Name: Frequency start value
Param.Desc: TX Frequency start value (value in MHz 2402-2480)

Param.Name: Frequency stop value
Param.Desc: TX Frequency stop value (value in MHz. 2402-2480)

Param.Name: Frequency step value
Param.Desc: TX Frequency step value (value in MHz. 0 means stay on the same frequency)

Param.Name: ACL TX Packet Type
Param.Desc: ACL TX Packet Type

Param.Name: ACL TX Packet Data Pattern
Param.Desc: ACL TX Packet Data Pattern

Param.Name: Power level index
Param.Desc: Range 0-10 : 10=Max Output Power, 0=Min Output Power. keep in mind value is written as is, make sure not to write illegal values

Param.Name: Disable whitening
Param.Desc: 0=Enable whitening, 1=Disable whitening

Param.Name: PRBS9 Init Value
Param.Desc: 0x0000-0x01FF: PRBS9 Init Value (Used only in PRBS9 patterns)

Param.Name: time between clusters in frames
Param.Desc: time between clusters in frames. minimal time is 3 frames

ExtDesc.p: This command is based on the Packet TX/RX command and is dedicated for the PLT flow of the TX Delay calibration. This command is sweeping the delay value between the PHY Amplitude and Phase paths in order to identify the best value to work with.

The following Standard Packet TX/RX parameters are fixed:
Frequency Mode – Single Freq. ,0x3
RX Single Frequency – No Rx, 0xFFFF
Disable Whitening – Disabled, 0x1
PRBS9 Init value – 0x01FF
The command transmits the requested number of packets at a specified frequency with a delay value and move to the next delay value until all requested delay values finished.
This sequence saves the delay value before it starts and restores it’s value when the sequence is finished.

Param.Name: Number of packets
Param.Desc: Specifies the number of packets to transmit at a specific frequency [UINT32]. Default = 0xFFFFFFFF, means unlimited number of packets.

Param.Name: Delay start value
Param.Desc: values between (-32) and (32).gives the ability to sweep wanted Delay Values from the start value to the stop value in step value resolution. [value in ns, step size is UINT].

Param.Name: Delay stop value
Param.Desc: values between (-32) and (32). gives the ability to sweep wanted Delay Values from the start value to the stop value in step value resolution. [value in ns, step size is UINT].

Param.Name: Delay step value
Param.Desc: values between (0) and (32). gives the ability to sweep wanted Delay Values from the start value to the stop value in step value resolution. [value in ns, step size is UINT].

Param.Name: TX Single Frequency
Param.Desc: 2402 - 2480 MHz, 0xFFFF no TX

Param.Name: ACL TX Packet Type
Param.Desc: ACL TX Packet Type

Param.Name: ACL TX Packet Data Pattern
Param.Desc: ACL TX Packet Data Pattern

Param.Name: Power level index
Param.Desc: Range 0-10 : 10=Max Output Power, 0=Min Output Power. keep in mind value is written as is, make sure not to write illegal values

Param.Name: time between clusters in frames
Param.Desc: time between clusters in frames. minimal time is 3 frames

Param.Name: debug traces debug mask
Param.Desc: The bit mask enabling the relevant PHY traces

ExtDesc.p:
This VS stops the activity of the following PHY tests currently running:
HCI_VS_Con_Tx
HCI_VS_Con_Rx
HCI_VS_Packet_TX_RX
HCI_VS_BER_and_RSSI_Meter_Start
HCI_VS_UOTA_Start_Test_List (or any phase during UOTA configuration using HCI_VS_UOTA_xxx commands)
When this command is completed, the Controller is ready to receive another PHY Test command.

This command will activate the internal SW based BER meter. As part of reception RSSI min, max and average are stored. The VS command controls the reception frequency & the packet/connection parameters. The Controller synchronizes on peer transmission by opening a continuous reception window. Upon synchronization BER meter is triggered.
Note: 8DH5 packet type is not supported

Param.Name: Frequency Channel
Param.Desc: Frequency Channel

Param.Name: BD Address
Param.Desc: BD address of the device being tested by its internal BER meter

Param.Name: LT Address
Param.Desc: LT Address

Param.Name: ACL Packet Type
Param.Desc: ACL Packet Type

Param.Name: Number of packets
Param.Desc: Number of packets from 0 to 65,535

Param.Name: PRBS Initialize
Param.Desc: PRBS Init state

Param.Name: POLL Period
Param.Desc: POLL period given in number of BT frames

ExtDesc.p:
This command allows reading of the BER and RSSI meter status.
The caller can trigger counters reset in order clear BER and RSSI results. This should be done after peer transmission power change.
Time counter start running when first synchronized to master.
Note: Counters wrap when reach max value.

Param.Name: Reset Counters
Param.Desc: 0-ignore parameter, 1- reset counters

Param.Name: Finished at least 1 test
Param.Desc: 0 - First test has not been finished, 1 - Values are valid for current measurement

Param.Name: Number of packet received in current measurement
Param.Desc: The number of received packets that are good for BER measurement. (Packet Header, length and payload header are correct)

Param.Name: Total bits received in current measurement
Param.Desc: The number of bits that were received in packets that are considered good for BER measurement

Param.Name: Number of bits error found in current measurement
Param.Desc: The number of bit errors in single test cycle

Param.Name: Time since the beginning of the test
Param.Desc:
In BT frames.
Time counter is triggered upon synchronization

Param.Name: PER due to CRC in current measurement
Param.Desc: Total number of packets with wrong CRC (deduced from wrong length / wrong payload header / BER)

Param.Name: PER due to Hec in current measurement
Param.Desc: Total number of packets with bad HEC

Param.Name: Number of good packets received in current measurement
Param.Desc: Total number of packets with no errors

Param.Name: Sync counter in current measurement
Param.Desc: Total number of syncs

Param.Name: Max Rssi in current measurement
Param.Desc:
Minimal RSSI measured on a single packet
Returned RSSI is in 9.4s notation. In order to get the real rssi value divided by 16

Param.Name: Min Rssi in current measurement
Param.Desc:
Maximal RSSI measured on a single packet
Returned RSSI is in 9.4s notation. In order to get the real rssi value divided by 16

Param.Name: AVG Rssi in current measurement
Param.Desc:
Average RSSI measured on all packets received
Returned RSSI is in 9.4s notation. In order to get the real rssi value divided by 16

Command.name: HCI_VS_Configure_Number_Of_Completed_Packet_Threshold
Command.Desc: Configure the # of completed packet threshold

Param.Name: acl data threshold
Param.Desc: Threshold for acl flow control. 0xFF - Don't change

Param.Name: Mode
Param.Desc: 0 - Disabled, 1 - Signal Priority on possible eSCO RWIN, 2 - Signal Priority only on Master when slave bad HEC

Param.Name: Supported Commands Mask
Param.Desc: Supported Commands Mask - each bit represents a command. '1' means that the command supported, '0' means command not supported

Param.Name: VSC Version
Param.Desc: Indicate VSC version

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Activity Connection Handle

Param.Name: Connection Descriptor Bit Mask
Param.Desc: Describes the nature of the connection: bit 0 - Synchronous Voice (eSCO Magnet-voice-relay) bit 1 - Asynchronous Stereo Audio (A2DP) bit 2 - Asynchronous Voice (DoAP) bit 3 - Asynchronous Data (Generic high priority data flowing over ACL) bit 4 - Low-latency Data (Gaming)

Param.Name: Async Voice Burst Length
Param.Desc: Asynchronous voice data initial burst length in ms, starts whenever Asynchronous Voice bit mask transition from 0 -> 1

Command.name: HCI_VS_BLE_Black_List_clear

Param.Name: Number of available entries
Param.Desc: How many entries can be inserted into the list

Command.Desc: This command is used to clean up the balck list for ADV->CONN

Command.name: HCI_VS_BLE_Black_List_Delete

Param.Name: Address Type

Command.name: HCI_VS_Reset_Random_Seed

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Command.Desc: This command reset the random mechanism to the start of the seed

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: ACL handle of the destination to which we send the debug LMP.

Command.name: HCI_VS_BLE_Set_Min_Active_Channels

Param.Name: minimum active channels
Param.Desc: Minimum active channel numbers for LE connection, between 2 (min in spec) and 37 (number of all LE connection channels)

Command.Desc: This command is used to set minimum number of active channels for LE AFH

Param.Name: Tsam
Param.Desc: The Tsam parameter marks the periodicity of the activity that is to be protected, measured in slots, and shall be an even integer so as to contain TX/RX slot pairs.

Param.Name: SAM_Map_Length
Param.Desc: The SAM_Map_Length parameter marks the length of the SAM_Map in number of submaps. This parameter is equal to Nsam-sm range 0 to 48

Param.Name: SAM_Map
Param.Desc: The SAM_Map parameter indicates the requested SAM_Map to be published. Encoding of the SAM_Map shall be according to the BT SIG SAM specification (submaptype code)

Param.Name: SAM_Type0_Map
Param.Desc: The SAM_Type0_Map is used to specify the availability of individual slots for those submaps shown as having type 0 in the SAM_Map field. The SAM_Type0_Map is encoded according to the BT SIG SAM specification (slot type code). The effective length of this field is equal to T_SAM / SAM_Map_Length. MSBs are ignored, LSBs are used.

Param.label: num_of_handles
Param.Name: Num_Conn_Handles
Param.Desc: The Num_Conn_Handles indicates the number of connection handles provided later

Param.Name: Conn_Handle
Param.Desc: This parameter indicates the connection handle on which the request is to be sent (and to which the local controller shall update it’s scheduling algorithm).The size of this field is 2 bytes (12 meaningful bits) per connection

Param.Name: Conn_Handle
Param.Desc: This parameter indicates the connection handles on which the request is to be sent (and to which the local controller shall update it’s scheduling algorithm).The size of this field is 2 bytes (12 meaningful bits) per connection

Param.Name: Connection_Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle(12 meaningful bits) of the connection that its SAM status was changed

Param.Name: Local_SAM_Index
Param.Desc: The index of the current SAM slot map used by the local device.0xFF means SAM is disabled (i.e. all slots are available)

Param.Name: Local_SAM_TX_Availability
Param.Desc: The proportion of slots available for the local device to transmit. 0 represents "less than 1 in 255" and 255 represents "all"; other proportions shall be linearly scaled. That is, Local_SAM_TX_Availability = (total_avail- able_TX_slots / local_TSAM) * 255, rounded to the integer below, where total_available_TX_slots is the total number of slots available for transmission in the current local SAM slot map and local_TSAM is TSAM for the current local SAM slot map.

Param.Name: Local_SAM_RX_Availability
Param.Desc: The proportion of slots available for the local device to receive. 0 represents "less than 1 in 255" and 255 represents "all"; other proportions shall be linearly scaled. That is, Local_SAM_RX_Availability = (total_avail- able_RX_slots / local_TSAM) * 255, rounded to the integer below, where total_available_RX_slots is the total number of slots available for reception in the current local SAM slot map and local_ TSAM is TSAM for the current local SAM slot map.

Param.Name: Remote_SAM_Index
Param.Desc: The index of the current SAM slot map used by the remote device.0xFF means SAM is disabled (i.e. all slots are available)

Param.Name: Remote_SAM_TX_Availability
Param.Desc: The proportion of slots available for the remote device to transmit. 0 represents "less than 1 in 255" and 255 represents "all"; other proportions shall be linearly scaled. That is, Remote_SAM_TX_Availability = (total_available_TX_slots / remote_TSAM) * 255, rounded to the integer below, where total_available_TX_slots is the total number of slots available for transmission in the current remote SAM slot map and remote_TSAM is TSAM for the current remote SAM slot map.

Param.Name: Remote_SAM_RX_Availability
Param.Desc: The proportion of slots available for the remote device to receive. 0 represents "less than 1 in 255" and 255 represents "all"; other proportions shall be linearly scaled. That is, Remote_SAM_RX_Availability = (total_available_RX_slots / remote_TSAM) * 255, rounded to the integer below, where total_available_RX_slots is the total number of slots available for reception in the current remote SAM slot map and remote_TSAM is TSAM for the current remote SAM slot map.

Param.Name: Connection_Handle
Param.Desc: Connection handle(12 meaningful bits) of the connection its SAM had an error

ExtDesc.p: This command is used to tag specific connection handle as LE Audio link. Usually a pair of LE Audio links are created to support both Right and Left audio link and each audio link shall be tagged with separate Enable_LE_Audio command. When a connection set to LE Audio, the controller will reserve buffers for LE Audio data and when each link’s audio data is sent, the second link’s data shall be sent just next Tx slot of the first link’s Tx slot. With this manner, controller makes the time gap of each link’s audio to 1.25ms

Param.Name: Event_Conter_Offset
Param.Desc: Starting offset of event counter for encryption. Currently it’s not implemented and all zeros are used

Param.Name: Stream_Mode
Param.Desc: Stream mode is used to inform the audio link’s direction. Supported stream modes are:0x00 - Stream Mode Output, 0x10 - Stream Mode Input, 0x20 - Stream Mode Bidirectional

Param.Name: Tail_Slot
Param.Desc: Tail slot indicator is used to inform which link’s audio data should be sent first between 2 LE audio links. Tail slot values are:0x00 - Non tail slot, 0x01 - Tail slot. Non tail slot audio link should be sent first.

Param.Name: Connection_Handle
Param.Desc: Connection_Handle to be used to identify a connection

ExtDesc.p: This command is used to tag specific connection handle as LE Audio link. Usually a pair of LE Audio links are created to support both Right and Left audio link and each audio link shall be tagged with separate Enable_LE_Audio command. When a connection set to LE Audio, the controller will reserve buffers for LE Audio data and when each link’s audio data is sent, the second link’s data shall be sent just next Tx slot of the first link’s Tx slot. With this manner, controller makes the time gap of each link’s audio to 1.25ms

Param.Name: Event_Conter_Offset
Param.Desc: Starting offset of event counter for encryption. Currently it’s not implemented and all zeros are used

Param.Name: Stream_Mode and tail slot
Param.Desc: Stream mode is used to inform the audio link’s direction. Supported stream modes are:0x00 - Stream Mode Output, 0x10 - Stream Mode Input, 0x20 - Stream Mode Bidirectional. Tail slot indicator is used to inform which link’s audio data should be sent first between 2 LE audio links. Tail slot values are:0x00 - Non tail slot, 0x01 - Tail slot. Non tail slot audio link should be sent first

Param.Name: Connection_Handle
Param.Desc: Connection_Handle to be used to identify a connection

ExtDesc.p: This command validate that the parameters of the LE Audio connection are according to the LEA spec

Param.Name: First_handle
Param.Desc: First connection handle

Param.Name: Second_handle
Param.Desc: Second connection handlel

Param.Name: Interval
Param.Desc: The connection expected interval in frames

ExtDesc.p: This command returns the UOTA version implemented in the controller.Its purpose is enable run time host support for future generation of the UOTA API

Param.Name: UOTA_Version
Param.Desc: UOTA Version

ExtDesc.p: The command sets the common parameters for a new Simple LoopBack test list and causes the controller to enter test list load mode, expecting <Number of Tests> HCI_VS_UOTA_SLB_Add_Single_Test to follow.
If a UOTA configuration or execution session was previously started the host shall send HCI_VS_PHY_Test_Reset to clear the test status before starting again.

Param.Name: BD_Address
Param.Desc: The BD Address of the tester

Param.Name: LT_Address
Param.Desc: The LT Address of the DUT

Param.Name: Num_Of_Tests
Param.Desc: Number of tests in this Simple LoopBack test list(up to 50)

Param.Name: Sync_Timeout
Param.Desc: Sync Timeout enforced by the DUT in seconds

Param.Name: Max_Retries
Param.Desc: Maximum number of retries. When reached, test is aborted and an error is returned. The counter reset on a successful test

ExtDesc.p: The command adds a single Simple LoopBack test to the test list. Sending this command is allowed only after HCI_VS_UOTA_SLB_Init_Test_List was sent (and returned success) and until HCI_VS_UOTA_Start_Test_List is sent.
Note: Return status value 0x7 (Memory Capacity Exceeded) shall be used if the controller reached the maximum number of tests it can store.

Note: The controller may return status success even if more tests than were declared in HCI_VS_UOTA_SLB_Init_Test_List :<Number of Tests> are added as long as it doesn’t have implementation or resource limitation to do so.

Param.Name: Num_of_packets
Param.Desc: Number of packets in this test

Param.Name: Rx_Channel
Param.Desc: The Rx channel the DUT should listen on

Param.Name: Tx_Channel
Param.Desc: The Tx channel the DUT should transmit loopback packets on(255 -DUT should use Rx channel value for Tx

Param.Name: Tx_Power
Param.Desc: The Tx power index the DUT should use

Param.Name: Retry Offset
Param.Desc: The number of missing packets at a test that will trigger a retry on the previous test. Count is accumulative

ExtDesc.p: The command triggers the controller to start executing the last test list that was loaded into it using HCI_VS_UOTA_XXX_Init_Test_List & HCI_VS_UOTA_XXX_Add_Single_Test.
The test will be executed until it had finished successfully, ended due to an error or if HCI_VS_PHY_Test_Reset was received from the host.

This command returns the status of the test list being executed. The status returned by this command is valid during and after the test execution until the controller receives HCI_VS_PHY_Test_Reset and clears the test status.

Param.Name: Retry Counter
Param.Desc: Number of retries performed (The value compared to <Max Retries>)

Param.Name: sync
Param.Desc: 0=No Sync 1=Sync 2=Wrong

Command.name: HCI_VS_Finalize_logging
Command.Desc: This command is used by DIAGS in order to complete the process of collecting logs from the BT Controller. Upon reception of the command the BT firmware stops collecting logs. When receiving the command complete event, DIAGS can collect data from Log rings and dump it into files.

Command.Desc: This command configures a flash logging session.

ExtDesc.p: This command configures a flash logging session. Enable/disable toggles the feature, and a set of use cases determines what will be logged. The use cases appear in the form of a bitmap.

Command.name: HCI_VS_Test_BT_RFIC_IRQ
Command.ExtDesc:
The purpose of this commands is to test the RFIC_IRQ connectivity in PLT. The command triggers the assertion of the BT_RFIC_IRQ signal between the Samos and Henry. The Samos asserts this signal upon command complete. The command chosen is BT Temperature measurement.
The MAC shall trigger the PHY to send the BT_Rx_Stop command to Samos.
The MAC shall generate Success/Fail status in the Command Complete Event
(according to rfic_irq assertion)
Note: Samos needs to be enabled prior to sending this command (this command doesn’t turn on Samos).

Param.Name: protocol test
Param.Desc: cdt protocol to test.

Param.Name: trace rate
Param.Desc: In frames- e.g. rate of 10 means one log every 10 frame will be sent

Param.Name: test duration
Param.Desc: In frames- test duration

Param.Name: allowed stage
Param.Desc: which state is allowed for the test.

Param.Name: Log Count
Param.Desc: Count of logs to issue.

Param.Name: Script number
Param.Desc: Trigger one of the MAC scripter's scripts (1-32)

Param.Name: ETM Mode
Param.Desc: Count of logs to issue.

Param.Name: VS event mask
Param.Desc: Set bit mask of vendor specific events to be generated

Param.Name: VS event mask
Param.Desc: Bit Mask of vendor specific events to be generated

Command.name: HCI_VS_PHY_Set_RF_Calibration_Info
Command.ExtDesc: This command sets calibration mode. This command enables the user to define the calibrations run order. If current calibration is successful, then we proceed to the next in order. If calibration isn’t successful, it will be repeated for several attempts with a certain interval between two successive calibrations. Number of attempts and the interval between them are both user defined in this VS command.

Param.Name: Temperature change for calibration
Param.Desc: Temperature change delta value for triggering periodic calibrations. 0xFF = Don't change

Param.label: NOT_IN_USE
Param.Name: Short calibration indication
Param.Desc: Checked box = short calibration, Unchecked box = not short calibration; 0x0000-0xFFFF: short calibration bitmap, 0xFFFFFFFF: Keep last bitmap.

Param.label: NOT_IN_USE
Param.Name: Calibrations with antenna
Param.Desc: Checked box = use antenna, Unchecked box = don't use antenna; 0x0000-0xFFFF: antenna bitmap, 0xFFFFFFFF: Keep last bitmap.

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: reserved

Param.Name: Interference delay_ms
Param.Desc: Trigger same calibration in [x] ms in case of non successive attempt due to general interference

Param.Name: Num of calib interf attempts

Command.name: HCI_VS_Trace_Capture_History
Command.Desc: This command is used to capture traces history of a given handle.

ExtDesc.p:
This command is used to capture traces history of a given handle.
Capture history procedure should be used when BTC logging transport is disabled completely,
and only when a problem is detected and capture history procedure is initiated,
BTC will copy all internal trace buffers to flash.
Event(s) generated:

When the Controller receives this command, it shall send Command Status event to the Host.
Command status event return unsupported value if given handle or transport filter are not supported.
Command status event return command disallowed if capture history operation is already ongoing or BTC logging transport is not disabled.
In addition, when the Controller determines the operation is completed, the Controller shall send VS Trace Capture History Complete event to Host.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: for W2: BT_FW_LOGGER = 0, BT_FW_SNIFFER = 1, ALL_HANDLES = 255

Param.Name: Transport filter bitmask
Param.Desc: Transport filter bitmask for the given handle. If bit is 1, transport is enabled.

Param.Name: Number of frames ahead
Param.Desc: Capture operation will start in number of frames (frame = 1.25ms). Set 0 to indicate now.

Param.Name: Capture reason
Param.Desc: Indicate the reason for the capture operation.

Command.name: HCI_VS_Set_Trace_Source_Filter
Command.Desc: This command is used to set trace source filter bitmask. If bit is 1, source is enabled.

ExtDesc.p: This command is used to set trace source filter bitmask. If bit is 1, source is enabled.

Param.Name: Source filter bitmask
Param.Desc: Trace source filter bitmask. If bit is 1, source is enabled.

Command.name: HCI_VS_Set_Trace_Transport_Filter
Command.Desc: This command is used to set transport filter bitmask for a given handle or for all handles. If bit is 1, transport is enabled.

ExtDesc.p: This command is used to set transport filter bitmask for a given handle or for all handles. If bit is 1, transport is enabled. In W2: Only UART Tx debug OR Binary logging allowed (Not both) In Marconi: Only 0 (disable) or enable all 0xD (UART AND Core Capture Continuous AND Core Capture Capture) allowed.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: BT_FW_LOGGER = 0, BT_FW_SNIFFER = 1, ALL_HANDLES = 0xFF For Marconi only: PHY Logger = 2, HCI Logger = 3, LMP = 4 , DASHBOARD = 5, HIGH_THROUGHPUT = 6, OSLOG Logger = 8 For W2 only: High Priority Logger = 7

ExtDesc.p: BT_FW_LOGGER = 0, BT_FW_SNIFFER = 1, ALL_HANDLES = 0xFF For Marconi only: PHY Logger = 2, HCI Logger = 3, LMP = 4 , DASHBOARD = 5, HIGH_THROUGHPUT = 6, OSLOG Logger = 8 For W2 only: High Priority Logger = 7

Param.Name: Transport filter bitmask
Param.Desc: Transport filter bitmask for the given handle. If bit is 1, transport is enabled. In W2: Only UART Tx debug OR Binary logging allowed (Not both) In Marconi: All of UART AND Core Capture Continuous AND Core Capture Capture allowed (All or nothing) If OSLOG handle (8) is picked 0 will disable OSLOG capturing anything else will enable it.

ExtDesc.p: Transport filter bitmask for the given handle. If bit is 1, transport is enabled. In W2: Only UART Tx debug OR Binary logging allowed (Not both) In Marconi: All of UART AND Core Capture Continuous AND Core Capture Capture allowed (All or nothing) If OSLOG handle (8) is picked 0 will disable OSLOG capturing anything else will enable it.

ExtDesc.p: This command sends the given payload directly to the PHY firmware. The purpose is the command is to enable independent development of PHY commands. Upon completion of the command a command complete event is generated with payload returned from the PHY firmware.
See reference – Marconi BT PHY VS Commands document.

The event is generated when the PHY firmware has completed processing the command.
A single command should be sent at a time - an additional command cannot be sent until command complete event is received.

ExtDesc.p: The PHY Generic command can be used to send pass-through commands to PHY.
Event(s) generated:

When the Controller receives response from the PHY it sends the response to the HCI.
In W2 the commands disregards the hdr flags and Coex protection in specific.

Param.Name: MSF Verification
Param.Desc: MSF verification result: 0 - ok, else - error

Command.name: HCI_VS_Read_RSSI
Command.Desc: Read RAW RSSI values for a Classic handle

ExtDesc.p: VS read rssi extends the spec command. The command can receive LE/BT handle or LE TESTMODE special handle - 0x300

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Read RSSI value without threshold for current handle, for LE TESTMODE special handle - 0x300

Param.Name: RSSI
Param.Desc: Return Rssi is in 8.4s notation. In order to get the real rssi value divided by 16

Command.name: HCI_VS_Read_Inst_RSSI
Command.Desc: Read instant RAW RSSI values for a Classic/LE handle

ExtDesc.p: The command can receive LE/BT handle or LE TESTMODE special handle - 0x300

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Read RSSI value without threshold for current handle, for LE TESTMODE special handle - 0x300

Param.Name: RSSI
Param.Desc: Return Rssi is in 8.4s notation for Marconi/Marconi2. In order to get the real rssi value divided by 16

Command.name: HCI_VS_WIBREE_AVOID_LE2M_THROUGHPUT_REDUCTION
Command.Desc: This command enable/disable the LE2M avoid low throughput mechanism. By defualt all mechanisms are enabled 1) Before LE connection setup, force master to avoide acceess address that will reduce throughput on LE2M. 2)If a bad AA will be used, don't accept transition to LE2M when phy negotiation is performed

ExtDesc.p: This command enable/disable the LE2M avoid low throughput mechanism. By defualt all mechanisms are enabled 1) Before LE connection setup, force master to avoide acceess address that will reduce throughput on LE2M. 2)If a bad AA will be used, don't accept transition to LE2M when phy negotiation is performed

Param.Name: Avoid bad aa
Param.Desc: 0=Don't Avoid,1=As Master don't use bad access address

Param.Name: Negotiate LE1M for bad AA enable disable
Param.Desc: 0=Don't negotiate 1M,1=Negotiate 1M for bad access address

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Set_Bad_Company_ID_For_LE2M
Command.Desc: This command enables / disable bad company id LE2M avoidance mechanism and set the bad compid list. By defualt mechanism is disabled and all company ID's are cleared. In order to use this command, host should send this command before creating connection and call it again (for disable) after connecion terminated

ExtDesc.p: This command enables / disable bad company id LE2M avoidance mechanism and set the bad compid list. By defualt mechanism is disabled and all company ID's are cleared. In order to use this command, host should send this command before creating connection and call it again (for disable) after connecion terminated

Param.Name: Number of bad company IDs
Param.Desc: 0=Disable, 0x1 - 0x4 Number of bad company IDs

Param.Name: MAX Event Duration
Param.Desc: set the max event duration

Param.Name: MAX Event Duration Connection Handle
Param.Desc: 0xFFE - Set Max number for all active connections otherwise - Set Max number for specific active connection

Param.Name: Voice override threshold
Param.Desc: number of connection intervals before LSTO in which BLE connection starts overriding voice

Param.Name: hid threshold
Param.Desc: Definitions the type of the BLE connections: Regular or HID. in frames

Param.Name: min trans distance in events
Param.Desc: Define the min indicate of the connEventCount when the channelMapNEW shall be applied,a minimum of 6 connection.in frames

Param.Name: LSTO number of intervals
Param.Desc: Number of intervals in create connection status before Link Supervision Timeout

Param.label: number_of_le_tx_rx_data_packet_pairs
Param.Name: Number of LE TX_RX Data Packets Pairs
Param.Desc: 0xFF - Do not change Otherwise - Max number of LE TX RX Data packet pairs

Param.Name: Number of LE TX_RX Data Packets Pairs Connection Handle
Param.Desc: 0xFFE - Set Max number for all active and future connections otherwise - Set Max number for specific active connection

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.Name: Create connection timeout
Param.Desc: Num of event to notify of connection setup timeout (Failed to be established). 0xFF - Do not change

Param.Name: smart notification
Param.Desc: Determine when connection complete notification will be send to host. When smart notification is enabled, the notification will be send only after first connection event occurs. In case it didn't occur the device will retry to connect. 0xFF(-1) - Do not change 0 - Disable smart notification otherwise - Enable smart notification.

Param.Name: Connect request retry
Param.Desc: When smart notification is enabled the parameter defines how many connect request retries until declaring 'failed to be established'. 0xFF - Do not change. 0xFE - Continue forever. Otherwise - # of retries

Param.Name: min_connect_adv_rssi_threshold
Param.Desc: Positive value including 0 - Do not change Negative value - Minimum allowed RSSI of connectable advertiser. Below this value 'connect req' won't be sent.

ExtDesc.p: Sets various LE parameters.

Param.Name: Connect request retry
Param.Desc: Configure the # of connection attempts.

Param.Name: Short Long threshold
Param.Desc: define the threshold between long and short sniff in mSec

Param.Name: Periodic Short Timer
Param.Desc: periodic trigger for Short sniff, integer multiply of *Tsniff. 0x1 - always running , 0x0 - the timer never trigger the AFH

Param.Name: Periodic Long Timer
Param.Desc: periodic trigger for Long sniff, integer multiply of *Tsniff. 0x1 - always running , 0x0 - the timer never trigger the AFH

Param.Name: No Sync RSSI threshold
Param.Desc: When RSSI level is above the threshold and we notice no Sync requires to active afh_scan, in dBm

Param.Name: SNR RSSI threshold
Param.Desc: When RSSI level is above the threshold and SNR under the threshold requires to active afh_scan, in dBm

Param.Name: Min SNR threshold
Param.Desc: When RSSI level is above the threshold and SNR under the threshold requires to active afh_scan

Param.Name: Short X 1sec timer
Param.Desc: Indicate number of time to repeat the afh_scan 1 sec timer loop (0 is NA)

Param.Name: Long X 1sec timer
Param.Desc: Indicate number of time to repeat the afh_scan 1 sec timer loop (0 is NA)

Param.Name: ULP Nscan Short Sniff
Param.Desc: Number of afh_scan to perform every time the 1 sec timer is expired

Param.Name: ULP Nscan Long Sniff
Param.Desc: Number of afh_scan to perform every time the 1 sec timer is expired

Param.Name: consecutive no sync
Param.Desc: Trig AFH scan if (frame_from_last_sync > interval*(latency +1+ consecutive_no_sync)) 0-0xFD,0xFE - consecutive equal to latency

Param.Name: min events between updates
Param.Desc: min events (interval * latency...) between two update channel map transactions

Param.Name: max events to block updates
Param.Desc: max events (interval * latency...) from last that update channel map transactions in which a new new map will be sent only if lots of channels have changed

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.Name: AFH Channel Assessment Mode
Param.Desc: 0x00 = BLE channel assessment disabled 0x01 = BLE channel assessment enabled

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Configure_Scan_Parameters
Command.Desc: This command is used to enable or disable filtering on duplicate advertising data.

Param.Name: Refresh Rate Threshold
Param.Desc: Set the Filter duplicate refresh rate threshold

Param.Name: check data
Param.Desc: Send event to host if ADV data was changed

Param.Name: wait for scan res
Param.Desc: Continue to send ADV ind event to host if Scan res did not received.

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.Name: Interval Threshold
Param.Desc: The interval threshold used to determine which Alpha to use: Short interval Alpha or long interval Alpha

Param.Name: Short interval Alpha
Param.Desc: The Alpha to use, as a fraction of 256. For instance, for a value of 0.75, use 0.75*256 = 192

Param.Name: Long interval Alpha
Param.Desc: The Alpha to use, as a fraction of 256. For instance, for a value of 0.25, use 0.25*256 = 64

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved

Param.label: _len
Param.Name: Data Size
Param.Desc: Number of compressed bytes in this packet

Param.Name: Values
Param.Desc: Compressed data to load.

Param.Name: Allowed Number of LE TX_RX Data Packet pairs
LE force update REQ or RSP LL parameters
Param.Desc: When Enable LL_CONNECTION_PARAM_REQ or LL_CONNECTION_PARAM_RSP PDU will use the given parameters

Param.Name: Min Connection Interval
Param.Desc: Proposed minimum interval in frames. connInterval = Conn_Interval * 1.25 ms, Conn_Interval range: 0x0006 to 0x0C80

Param.Name: Max Connection Interval
Param.Desc: Proposed maximum interval in frames.

Param.Name: Connection Latency
Param.Desc: Proposed connection latency. connSlaveLatency = Conn_Latency (as number of LL connection events). Conn_Latency range: 0x0000 to 0x01F4

Param.Name: Connection Timeout
Param.Desc: Proposed connection timeout. connTimeout = Conn_Timeout * 10 ms Conn_Timeout range: 0x000A to 0x0C80.

Param.Name: Preferred Periodicity
Param.Desc: Proposed Preferred Periodicity.

Param.Name: debug_referenceConnEventCount
Param.Desc: Represents reference count which is reference of offset parameter. Reference counter is being determine when sending the PDU and it will be calculated as => referenceConnEventCount = current_event_count + debug_referenceConnEventCount*(1+latency)

Param.Name: D offset
Param.Desc: D offset. The real offset to PDU will be calculated using referenceConnEventCount

Param.Name: D offset 1
Param.Desc: D offset 1. The real offset to PDU will be calculated using referenceConnEventCount

Param.Name: D offset 2

Param.Name: D offset 5
Param.Desc: D offset 5. The real offset to PDU will be calculated using referenceConnEventCount

Param.Desc: Depending on the bitmap is the interpretation of the field

Param.Name: Reserved
Param.Desc: Reserved for future use

Param.Name: BUX Low Limit
Param.Desc: BUX RSSI Low Limit in dBm. After activating BUX this limit is used to trigger BUX deactivation (-127 - +127, 0x80(-128):Don't change)

Param.Name: CRC and No Sync increment factor

Param.Name: CRC and No Sync decrement factor
Param.Desc: Decrement factor used for the CRC and No Sync counter (0x00-0xFE, 0xFF - Don't change)

Event.name: HCI_ACL_Data_Event
Event.Macro: ev = hci.Wait_HCI_ACL_Packet_Event(kwargs.timeout, kwargs.Connection_Handle, kwargs.Boundary, kwargs.Broadcast_flag, Any) # convert hex to string and discard the L2CAP part data = ev.Parameters.Data.decode('hex') ev = hci.Events.HCI_ACL_Data_Event(ev.Parameters.Connection_Handle, ev.Parameters.Boundary, data, ev.Parameters.Broadcast_flag) if hasattr(kwargs.Data, 'set'): kwargs.Data.set(data) elif kwargs.Data is not Any and \ kwargs.Data != data: raise UnexpectedEventError(ev) return ev

Param.Name: Boundary
Param.Desc: 0-Start Non-Flushable 1-Continuation 2-Start Flushable

Param.Name: Broadcast flag
Param.Desc: 0-No broadcast 1-active 2-all

Command.name: HCI_ACL_DataL2CAP
Command.Macro: data_len = len(kwargs.Text) data = ''.join([struct.pack('<H',data_len), '\xD1\xDA', kwargs.Text]) hci.Send_HCI_ACL_Packet(kwargs.Connection_Handle, kwargs.Boundary, kwargs.Broadcast_flag, data.encode('hex'))

Param.Name: Boundary
Param.Desc: 0-Start Non-Flushable 1-Continuation 2-Start Flushable

Param.Name: Broadcast flag
Param.Desc: 0-No broadcast 1-active 2-all

Event.name: HCI_ACL_DataL2CAP_Event
Event.Macro: ev = hci.Wait_HCI_ACL_Packet_Event(kwargs.timeout, kwargs.Connection_Handle, kwargs.Boundary, kwargs.Broadcast_flag, Any) # convert hex to string and discard the L2CAP part data = ev.Parameters.Data.decode('hex')[4:] ev = hci.Events.HCI_ACL_Data_Event(ev.Parameters.Connection_Handle, ev.Parameters.Boundary, data, ev.Parameters.Broadcast_flag) if hasattr(kwargs.Data, 'set'): kwargs.Data.set(data) elif kwargs.Data is not Any and \ kwargs.Data != data: raise UnexpectedEventError(ev) return ev

Event.name: HCI_LE_Generic_Report_Event
Event.Desc: "HCI_LE_Generic_Report_Event" is LE spec event. It includes proprietary w2 subevent "LE Scan Req Fast Connect Request Event"

ExtDesc.p: "HCI_LE_Generic_Report_Event" is LE spec event. It includes proprietary w2 subevent "LE Scan Req Fast Connect Request Event opcode (0xF1)"
"LE Scan Req Fast Connect Request Event" is being raised to host as a part of fast connect process, only if fast connect feature is enabled.

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Used to identify a connection. Range: 0x0000-0x0EFF

Param.Name: Interval Min
Param.Desc: Minimum value of the connection interval requested by the remote device. Range: 7.5msec to 4seconds. Resolution=1.25msec

Param.Name: Interval Max
Param.Desc: Maximum value of the connection interval requested by the remote device. Range: 7.5msec to 4seconds. Resolution=1.25msec

Param.Name: Latency
Param.Desc: Maximum allowed slave latency for the connection specified as the number of connection events requested by the remote device. Range: 0-499

Param.Name: Timeout
Param.Desc: Supervision timeout for the connection requested by the remote device. Range: 0x000A to 0x0C80. Resolution=10msec

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Used to identify a connection. Range: 0x0000-0x0EFF

Param.Name: MaxTxOctets
Param.Desc: The maximum number of payload octets in a Link Layer Data Channel PDU that the local Controller will send on this connection - connEffectiveMaxTxOctets. Range 0x001B-0x00FB, 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: MaxTxTime
Param.Desc: The maximum time that the local Controller will take to send a Link Layer Data Channel PDU on this connection - connEffectiveMaxTx. Range 0x0148-0x0848, 0x0000 - 0x0127 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: MaxRxOctets
Param.Desc: The maximum number of payload octets in a Link Layer Data Channel PDU that the local controller expects to receive on this connection. Range 0x001B-0x00FB, 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: MaxRxTime
Param.Desc: The maximum time that the local Controller expects to take to receive a Link Layer Data Channel PDU on this connection. Range 0x0148-0x0848, 0x0000 - 0x0127 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: Status
Param.Desc: Event status

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Used to identify a connection. Range: 0x0000-0x0EFF

Param.Name: TX_PHY
Param.Desc: TX phy rate value. (0x01) -> 1Mbps, (0x02) -> 2Mbps , (0x03) -> LR

Param.Name: RX_PHY
Param.Desc: RX phy rate value. (0x01) -> 1Mbps, (0x02) -> 2Mbps , (0x03) -> LR

Param.Name: Advertising Handle
Param.Desc: Used to identify a advertise handle. Range: 0x00-0xEF

Param.Name: Scanner_Address_Type
Param.Desc: 0x00 Public device Address, 0x01 Random device address, 0x02 Public Identity Address (corresponds to resolved private address), 0x03 Random (static) identity address (corresponds to resolved private address)

Param.Name: Scanner Address
Param.Desc: Public Device Address, Random Device Address, Public Identity Address or Random (static) Identity Address of the advertising device

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Used to identify a connection. Range: 0x0000-0x0EFF

Param.Name: Channel_Selection_Algorithm
Param.Desc: 0x00 LE Channel Selection Algorithm #1 is used, 0x01 LE Channel Selection Algorithm #2 is used

Param.Name: Advertising Handle
Param.Desc: Used to identify a advertise handle. Range: 0x00-0xEF

Param.Name: Scanner_Address_Type
Param.Desc: 0x00 Public device Address, 0x01 Random device address, 0x02 Public Identity Address (corresponds to resolved private address), 0x03 Random (static) identity address (corresponds to resolved private address)

Param.Name: Scanner Address
Param.Desc: Public Device Address, Random Device Address, Public Identity Address or Random (static) Identity Address of the advertising device

Param.label: DataLength
Param.Name: Data Length
Param.Desc: 0-31 bytes. The data length can vary.

Param.Name: Data
Param.Desc: The actual data that was attached to the proprietary Scan Request

Param.Name: Data Packet Length
Param.Desc: Max length of data packets

Param.Name: Number of Data Packets
Param.Desc: Number of Data Packets

Param.Name: Feature Set
Param.Desc: LE Controller feature support bit map. This is treated as a parameter in which the LSO is transmitted first.

Param.Name: Number of empty entries
Param.Desc: Number of empty entries in the device address White List in the LE Controller. Range: 0x01 to 0xFF

Param.Name: Device Address Type
Param.Desc: Indicates device address type of the address added to the list. 0x00 = Public address, 0x01 = Random address, 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Device Address
Param.Desc: Device address that is to be added to the White List.

Param.Name: Device Address Type
Param.Desc: Indicates device address type of the address added to the list. 0x00 = Public address, 0x01 = Random address, 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Device Address
Param.Desc: Device address that is to be added to the White List.

Param.Name: Advertise Min Interval
Param.Desc: advIntervalmin = Adv_Interval_Min * 0.625 ms, advIntervalmin range: 20 ms to 10.24 s, Does not apply to connectable directed events.

Param.Name: Advertise Max Interval
Param.Desc: advIntervalmax = Adv_Interval * 0.625 ms, advIntervalmax range: 20 ms to 10.24 s, advIntervalmax shall be set to a value equal to or greater than the advIntervalmin Values outside the range are reserved. Does not apply to connectable directed events.

Param.Name: Advertising Type
Param.Desc: Used to determine the packet type that is used for advertising when advertising is enable 0x00 - Connectable undircted advertising (ADV_IND)(default) 0x01 - Connectable high duty cycle directed advertising(ADV_DIRECT_IND) 0x02 - Scannable undirected advertising (ADV_SCAN_IND) 0x03 - Non connectable undirected advertising (ADV_NONCONN_IND) 0x04 - Connectable low duty cycle directed advertising (ADV_DIRECT_IND, low duty cycle) 0x05 - 0xFF - Reserved for future use

Param.Name: Own_Address_Type
Param.Desc: Public or random device address to use. The default is to use public

Param.Name: Direct Address Type
Param.Desc: Public or random device address to use.The default is to use public

Param.Name: Advertising Channel Map
Param.Desc: Which channels out of 3 Adv channels to be used

Param.Name: Advertising Filter Policy
Param.Desc: Advertiser filtering policy to be applied

Param.Name: Advertising Channel TX Power
Param.Desc: Transmit power of advertising channel

Param.Name: Advertise Mode
Param.Desc: 0x01 = On (start advertising), 0x00 = Off (stop advertising), 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Advertise Mode
Param.Desc: 0x01 = On (start advertising), 0x00 = Off (stop advertising), 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Advertise Timeout
Param.Desc: Timeout value in units of 125 ms. 31.875 seconds Max.

Param.Name: Status
Param.Desc: Command status

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Create_Extended_Advertise_Instance
Command.Desc: This command is used to create a new extended advertising instance. If Address_Type is set to Random Device Address, the host should provide the random address assigned to this instance. If the random address is already in use, this command will fail with Wrong Parameters error code. If Address_Type is set to Public Device Address only one such instance can be created. If an instance with public address already exists, or standard LE advertising is enabled with public address, this command will fail with Wrong Parameters error code.

Param.Name: Address Type
Param.Desc: 0x00 = Public Device Address, 0x01 = Random Device Address, 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Address
Param.Desc: Advertisement BD Address

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Remove_Extended_Advertise_Instance
Command.Desc: This command is used to remove an extended advertising instance created through Create Extended Advertising Instance VSC. If a nonexistent handle is provided, this command will fail with Wrong Parameters error code.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Set_Extended_Advertising_Parameters
Command.Desc: This command is used to configure an existing extended advertising instance. The Handle parameter is used to specify the extended advertising instance to be configured. If a nonexistent handle is provided, this command will fail with Wrong Parameters error code. Notes: The Address type is already initiated in allocation. There is no support in direct advertisement.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: Advertise Min Interval
Param.Desc: Time = Val * 0.625 msec, range: 20 ms (0x0020) to 10.24 s (0x4000)

Param.Name: Advertise Max Interval
Param.Desc: Time = Val * 0.625 msec, range: 20 ms (0x0020) to 10.24 s (0x4000)

Param.Name: Advertising Type
Param.Desc: Used to determine the packet type that is used for advertising when advertising is enable 0x00 - Connectable undirected advertising (ADV_IND)(default) 0x01 - Connectable high duty cycle directed advertising(ADV_DIRECT_IND) - UNSUPPORTED 0x02 - Scannable undirected advertising (ADV_SCAN_IND) 0x03 - Non connectable undirected advertising (ADV_NONCONN_IND) 0x04 - Connectable low duty cycle directed advertising (ADV_DIRECT_IND, low duty cycle) - UNSUPPORTED 0x05 - 0xFF - Reserved for future use

Param.Name: Advertising Channel Map
Param.Desc: 1 - Enable channel 37 use, 2 - Enable channel 38 use, 4 - Enable channel 39 use, 7 - All

Param.Name: Advertising Filter Policy
Param.Desc: 0x00 - Process scan and connection requests from all devices 0x01 - Process connection requests from all devices and only scan requests from devices in the White list 0x02 - Process scan requests from all devices and only connection requests from devices in the White list 0x03 - Process scan and connection requests only from devices in the White list

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Set_Extended_Advertising_Data
Command.Desc: This command is used to set the data used in advertising packets that have a data field. These advertising packets will be sent out at their corresponding extended advertising instance created through Create Extended Advertising Instance VSC.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: Data Length
Param.Desc: Range: 0x00 - 0x1F

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Set_Extended_Scan_Response_Data
Command.Desc: This command is used to provide data used in Scanning packets that have a data field. These Scanning packets are associated with certain extended advertising instance created through Create Extended Advertising Instance VSC.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.label: Scan_response_Data_Length
Param.Name: Data Length
Param.Desc: Range: 0x00 - 0x1F

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Set_Extended_Advertising_Enable
Command.Desc: This command is used to enable or disable an extended advertising instance and specify a timeout for the advertisement. If Timeout is specified, the associated advertising instance will be disabled after Timeout amount of time has passed and LE Timeout Advertising Report Event has been sent to the host. Timeout and Timeout_Event_enable fields are ignored when Enable is set to Stop advertising.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: Advertise Mode
Param.Desc: 0x01 = On (start advertising), 0x00 = Off (stop advertising), 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Timeout
Param.Desc: Timeout in Seconds, 0 - infinite.

Param.Name: Timeout Event Enable
Param.Desc: 0x00 - Don’t generate an event on timeout, 0x01 - Generate

Param.Name: Event Mask
Param.Desc: Configured BLE events mask

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Update_Extended_Advertise_Instance_Address
Command.Desc: This command is used to update an existing advertising instance address. If Address_Type is set to Random Device Address, the host should provide the random address assigned to this instance. If the random address is already in use, this command will fail with Wrong Parameters error code. If Address_Type is set to Public Device Address only one such instance can exist. If an instance with public address already exists, or standard LE advertising is enabled with public address, this command will fail with Wrong Parameters error code. The address may be changed while advertising is in progress, without requiring host stop and restart advertising for the new address to be used.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement

Param.Name: Address Type
Param.Desc: 0x00 = Public Device Address, 0x01 = Random Device Address, 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Address
Param.Desc: Advertisement BD Address

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Set_Data_Length_Extended
Command.Desc: This command allows the Host to suggest maximum tx and rx packet size and maximum packet tx and rx time to be used for a given connection.

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Local identifier of the LL connection to which the command applies

Param.Name: TxOctets
Param.Desc: Preferred maximum number of payload octets that the local Controller should include in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x001B-0x00FB. 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: TxTime
Param.Desc: Preferred maximum number of microseconds that the local Controller should use to transmit a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x0148-0x0848. 0x0000 - 0x0147 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: RxOctets
Param.Desc: Preferred maximum number of payload octets that the remote Controller requested to include in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x001B-0x00FB. 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: TxTime
Param.Desc: Preferred maximum number of microseconds that the remote Controller requested to transmit a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x0148-0x0848. 0x0000 - 0x0147 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: Connection Handle
Param.Desc: Local identifier of the LL connection to which the command was applied

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Read_Suggested_Default_Data_Length_Extended
Command.Desc: This command allows the Host to read the Host's preferred values for the Controller's maximum tx and rx number of payload octets and maximum packet tx and rx time to be used for new connections

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxTxOctets
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of payload octets that the local Controller advised to include in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x001B-0x00FB. 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxTxTime
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of microseconds that the local Controller advised to include in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x0148-0x0848. 0x0000 - 0x0147 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxRxOctets
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of payload octets that the local Controller is advised to request in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x001B-0x00FB. 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxRxTime
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of microseconds that the local Controller advised to request in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x0148-0x0848. 0x0000 - 0x0147 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Command.name: HCI_VS_LE_Write_Suggested_Default_Data_Length_Extended
Command.Desc: This command allows the Host to specify its preferred values for the Controller's maximum tx and rx number of payload octets and maximum packet tx and rx time to be used for new connections. The Controller may use smaller or larger values based on local information.

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxTxOctets
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of payload octets that the local Controller advised to include in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x001B-0x00FB. 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxTxTime
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of microseconds that the local Controller advised to include in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x0148-0x0848. 0x0000 - 0x0147 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxRxOctets
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of payload octets that the local Controller is advised to request in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x001B-0x00FB. 0x0000 - 0x001A and 0x00FC - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Param.Name: SuggestedMaxRxTime
Param.Desc: Suggested maximum number of microseconds that the local Controller advised to request in a single Link Layer Data Channel PDU. Range 0x0148-0x0848. 0x0000 - 0x0147 and 0x0849 - 0xFFFF Reserved for future use

Command.Desc: Configure the maximum pairs to support for a LE peripheral link. This is required and used on for Slave side only

Param.Desc: In slots

Event.name: HCI_VS_LE_Extended_Advertising_Timeout_Report_Event
Event.Desc: This VSE will be sent to the host only if the following conditions are met. The associated advertising instance will be disabled after this event is sent to the host. The time specified in Set Extended Advertising Enable timeout field has passed. Timeout Event is enabled through Set Extended Advertising Enable.

Param.Name: Handle
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: diff_with_lmp_btclk
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: diff_with_lmp_ms
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: btclk_diff
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: ms_diff
Param.Desc: Handle to be used to identify an advertisement.Handle 0x00 is reserved for spec advertisement , thus if passed to this command will return an error.

Param.Name: Scanning Filter Policy
Param.Desc: 0 - Accept all advertisement packets,1 Ignore advertisement packets from devices not in the White List Only

Param.Name: Scan Enable
Param.Desc: 0x01 = On (start scanning), 0x00 = Off (stop scanning), 0x02-0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Filter Duplicates
Param.Desc: 0x0 = Duplicate filtering is disabled, 0x01 = Duplicate filtering is enabled

Param.Name: Scan Interval
Param.Desc: Time between consecutive scans. scanInterval = Scan_Interval * 0.625 ms, scanInterval range: 2.5 ms to 10.24 s, Scan_Interval range: 0x0004 to 0x4000.

Param.Name: Scan Window
Param.Desc: Duration of the scan. scanWindow = Scan_Window * 0.625 ms, scanWindow range: 2.5 ms to 10.24 s, Scan_Window range: 0x0004 to 0x4000.

Param.Name: Initiator_Filter_Policy
Param.Desc: 0x00 = White List not used but the advertiser’s address in this command is used, 0x01 = White List is used and the advertiser’s address in this command is not used, 0x02 – 0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Peer Device Address Type
Param.Desc: Valid only if White_List = 0x00. Indicates address type of the advertiser’s address. 0x00 = Public address, 0x01 = Random address, 0x02 – 0xFF = Reserved.

Param.Name: Peer Device Address
Param.Desc: Valid only if White_List = 0x00. Device address of the advertiser to which the connection is to be created.

Param.Name: Local Device Address Type
Param.Desc: Indicates whether to use own public or private device address. 0x00 = Public address, 0x01 = Random address, 0x02 – 0xFF = Reserved

Param.Name: Connection Latency
Param.Desc: connSlaveLatency = Conn_Latency (as number of LL connection events). Conn_Latency range: 0x0000 to 0x01F3.

Param.Name: Connection Timeout
Param.Desc: connTimeout = Conn_Timeout * 10 ms Conn_Timeout range: 0x000A to 0x0C80.

Param.Name: Minimum Length

Command.name: HCI_VS_Set_LE_Test_Mode_Parameters
Command.Desc: This command is used to configure extended LE Test Mode parameters.

Param.Name: TX_Frequency_Hopping_Step
Param.Desc: 0x00: BLE regular test in a fixed channel. 0x01-0x24: BLE test with TX frequency hopping in data channel with specified hopping step.

Param.Name: TX Power Level
Param.Desc: Transmit power level

Param.Name: RX Mode
Param.Desc: Choose the RX Mode to Use: 0- Connection Mode, 1- Best RF Mode (ADPLL Closed Loop), 2- Low Current Mode (ADPLL Open Loop), 3- Scan Mode

Param.Name: Packets to transmit
Param.Desc: A number of packets to transmit. 0 means continuous TX.

Param.Name: BLE Access Code
Param.Desc: An access code to sync/transmit. Default value is 0x71764129.

Param.label: ble_berm_en
Param.Name: BLE BER Test Enable
Param.Desc: Enable of the BER test

Param.Name: BLE BER Test pattern
Param.Desc: A data pattern of the payload that is expected to be received

Param.Name: BER Test packet length
Param.Desc: A number of payload bytes that are expected to be received in the BER test

Param.Name: BER FA Threshold
Param.Desc: A threshold for the FA detection

Param.Name: Trace Enable
Param.Desc: Enables or Disables traces during the BER test

Param.Name: Reference CRC
Param.Desc: Reference CRC value for the packet, in BLE 24 LSB bits are used, in OTHER_IP 16 LSB, 0xFFFFFFFF means don't change

Command.Desc: "This command is used to configure modulation index LE transmitter test"

Param.Name: TS_Status
Param.Desc: Result of transport switch: 0x00: Success. 0x01: Fail due to host not accepting incoming connection request in time or explicitly rejecting. 0x02: Fail due to insufficient resource (can not allocate anymore ACL). 0x03: Fail because switch is already in progress. 0x04: ACL with same bt addr already exists. 0x05: TS request from peer side is rejected because of link layer transaction collision.

Param.Name: LL_TS_Exchange_Duration
Param.Desc: For master, this is the duration from receiving HCI Create Connection from host, to sending the first POLL to slave. For slave, this is the duration from receiving the first BLE LL packet, to receiving the first POLL from master.

Param.Name: Classic_Setup_Duration
Param.Desc: For master, this is the duration from sending the first POLL to slave, to before sending HCIE Connection Complete to host. For slave, this is the duration from receiving the first POLL from master, to before sending HCIE Connection Complete to host.
